Title: Delicious Singapore street food in comfortable Melbourne restaurant.
partial_entry:
I have eaten dinner at Rasa Rasa with different friends three times. Every time the food was enjoyed and lauded by us all. The menu is not the largest by any means but it is full of fabulous dishes. Their Laksa is fabulous as is...their CKT as they refer to the delicious Char Kway Tiau. The spicy lamb is outstanding as is their Beef with Chinese broccoli. There are also fish and vegetarian dishes as well as a good range of curries. All dishes come in various stages of 'heat" marked on the menu with one to three cillis to denote the temperature and yes, you can ask for the degree of heat that suits you.  The prices vary from around $14 for the Laksa to $26 for the Spicy lamb. They charge $4 per person for corkage which is not unreasonable.
And yes, I have a booking for two weeks from now for s fourth visit.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: westernised Thai, sweet & expensive

Title: Great place for an intimate dinner

We were lucky to discover this gem!
Plenty of seating so not crowded or noisy.
A menu with everything.
We started with entrees of Chicken satay and vegetable curry puffs....For Mains we had Pad Preaw Wann - Stir Fried with Thai sweet & sour sauce & vegetables 
and Tom Yum Haeng - Prawns cooked in a clay pot with lemongrass, mushroom, onion, & special tom yum sauce. The flavours were spot on and one could tell that it was definitely cooked in a clay pot.
The staff was attentive but not intrusive.
Prices were reasonable for the quality of the food.
We had a great night and will come again.
Delicious food that always leaves me looking forward to my next visit.More

Title: Welcome Thai
partial_entry:
Welcome Thai has been around for years and I'm assuming through a few changes of hands.  I've been here a few times and the food is always delicious.  Pictured here is the Chicken Satay that I had for entree, and the Chicken Fried Rice for...the main meal.  Both were very good.  I would say the service was a little slow.  They, like many other places, annoyingly concentrate on take out orders first, and now that Uber Eats exists, this just adds to the backlog of orders to get out.  Therefore, if you're sitting at the restaurant, you end up waiting much longer than usual while they fulfil those first.  Frustrating, but as long as you're not in a rush, then I guess there's more time to chat with your friends.
The decor is simple but pretty and there's a lot of street parking outside so usually pretty easy to get a parking space.  Overall, I would come here again and recommend it to anyone looking for a good Thai meal out.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Flavoursome, aromatic & fresh Thai food
partial_entry: We have tried dozens of Thai restaurants in the hope of our expectations being met, and so far, there is only one acceptable restaurant on our list. However this place is perfectly satisfactory, with a decent menu, offering tofu & vegetable in all curries for...vegetarians (unlike most Thai restaurants).  We tried the vegetable curry puffs, which were delicious, & on request, served with peanut sauce rather than the provided thai chilli sauce. They were small compared to those elsewhere, but there were 4 to the serve, which was good. My husband tried the fish cakes which were apparently 'yum'. We then tried the gang massamum curry with tofu & veggies, which was a little more watery than I am used to, but delicious nevertheless. Husband tried the chilli sesame pork dish which was good, but did not have enough chilli in it to give it any kick. The garlic roti with peanut sauce was flaky & moreish, & a good side dish for the meal along with the usual coconut rice. The only negative to the meal was the less than optimal service, with only two girls working the floor, but they can perhaps be forgiven for underestimating how many of us didn't want to cook on this freezing cold, rainy Winter's night! It's not cheap by any stretch of the imagination, but we would recommend this restaurant & we will definitely visit again.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Zero Customer Service - Never Again
partial_entry:

I enquired...with intrigue as to how a restaurant that does not take bookings can possibly be booked out ?............Sorry but people take bookings without us knowing ?????? Wtf, how is this even possible ???

partial_entry: We were regulars here until last night when had the worst service and meal. Arrived and was seated at a table. Ordered entrees first the chicken Satay sticks and the roti wraps. The Satays and wraps appeared reheated and the chicken was dry and cold in the centre. Ordered the beef lemongrass stir fry and fried rice both came out in 5  minutes and the stir fry looked like it had been re heated and was a stew. The chicken fried rice was cold and warm in parts and dry. The place was packed and had heaps of takeaway orders but only a few in the kitchen so it was not possible to freshly cook the meals and get them out that quick. It’s a shame was a great place but has gone down hill rapidly. Goodbye Yim Yam.More

Title: One of the better Thai options in Coburg
partial_entry:
I've ordered both meals to eat-in and take away from here. I've found if you want their food at its best, eat in. The quality and serve size can't be beat. The service in the restaurant isn't bad either. 

The restaurant itself is a bit...run-of-the-mill when it comes to finishing and decor. Nothing special. It's all easy washed, fast food oriented. But the space isn't loud, so you'll be able to have a conversation while eating with your friends no problem. 

The take-away is a bit hit and miss though. Delivery times vary through menulog, and be careful as I have had them completely lose my order. The food seems to lose its taste a little too when being prepped for take away. But it still is good. 

*caution* - the spice level in this food sits more akin to traditional Thai. Ordering a curry in the restaurant, the 'mild' option is likely to be a little too on the spicy side for some still.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Authentic Thai food
partial_entry:
By sheer fate, we found this place and what an absolute culinary treat it was.  
This place has beautiful ambience with a wall mural, lighting and seating arrangements. Big tick!
Menu no by large which makes ordering easy but also means what they do prepare...is of the highest quality. 
We ordered chicken pad Thai, massaman curry, story fry with cashews and chilli jam plus entrees of paint sauce with roti, sprinkled by rolls and chicken wings. 
Portion sizes were large and the food so tasty. Service from one waitress was fast, efficient and very friendly. 
Parking can be challenging but at night much easier. Hood disabled access. Toilets on site. 
Dietaries well catered for. Price matches the quality.  
In summary, this is a must try restaurant for authentic Thai food with great atmosphere and service.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Authentic Thai Taste, Great Vibe and Star Service
partial_entry:
Let me start by saying I am a Thai Food fanatic, to the point that I can reference (in fact in preference to English!) many of their dishes by their native Thai names.

And I have had Thai food in Thailand itself as well as...in Thai food hotspots around South East Asia.  

I can say that this venue delivers the closest authentically leaning flavour profile (in a Western country) outside Thailand itself and its neighbouring South East Asia Thai-towns”.

Served piping hot, the food in this place is extraordinarily sumptuous and scrumptious and truly authentically seasoned to the pungent taste of freshly harvested Thai herbs!

Stand out dishes: Gaeng Keow Wan Gai (Green Curry Chicken), Tom Yum Goong (Hot Sour Prawn Soup), Pad Thai stir fried rice noodles and Sizzling Beef Stir Fry on a hotplate.

Lovely standout drink: Fresh coconut Juice on crushed ice which comes with the meat of young coconut. My favourite!

Ambience and vibe is like that of a nice Latin club with cool club-like music pumping along in the background.

They have a loyalty card as well where you get a free entree as a reward.

Last but not least, the service is top shelf ... you are made to feel very comfortable and pampered ... like a Thai King...

Timely service and what’s more, ever attentive, super friendly and obliging service as well, especially from their ever smiling, disarmingly charming and cheerfully sweet-natured angelic-faced young waitress, “Sai”.

She is so gentle and lovely to all the customers, both regulars and new.

Thank you Sai, for making my time here so enjoyable!

Frank.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Reincarnation and recommendation
partial_entry:
As far as my GPS has told me, this is a reincarnation of a previous Thai restaurant at the same address.. I have no knowledge of the previous ownership, and only came here as I have family who live nearby. I must say that I...was pleasantly surprised at the atmosphere, the service, and with the food.We even found parking close by, which has to be another definite plus. Although the restaurant is licensed, you can also BYO. We started with a range of entrees: vegetarian spring rolls, roti bread with peanut sauce, prawns and crab spring rolls, and the one I loved the best: potato wrapped prawns.
For mains we tried the Pad See We with prawns, duck and lychee curry, Cashew nut beef, and pepper tamarind prawns. All dishes come highly recommended.More

Title: Five Star presentation and taste
partial_entry:
My heading may seem overstated but both the presentation and flavour of our 3 appetisers and 3 main meals were magnificent- especially when considering the relatively low cost - it is excellent value.
Charm has been here in a little unpretentious restaurant for many years...and is further evidence of its sumptuous meals and value.
My Mum and partner joined me and each was similarly complimentary about our shared soft shell crab, Money bags and Fish cake starters followed by Massaman curry, duck curry and a type of seafood medley - all delicious.
The service is friendly, casual and mostly attentive - what you expect of a local and probably family run business, but the chef is fantastic.
Should you have to wait a while, you get to show your creative side by using the supplied crayons to draw some master pieces on the placemats.
Go here for a casual, excellent value and delicious meal.
Enjoy.More

Title: Casually Charmed
partial_entry:
After researching Thai in the area, I settled on Charm based on the reviews for a casual night out. 

On arrival we were met with a friendly face at the empty restaurant (6pm) and although there was a language barrier with the waitress, we went...on to order drinks, a few small starters and two mains. 

To begin, we had the scallops (1 each) which was the highlight of the order, followed by a small vegetarian salad (tofu) which had light flavours. 

The mains we ordered were the King Prawn Salad which consisted of about 10 prawns, and iceberg lettuce with flavours - not something that would fill most as a main! The second main item was a Tofu Sizzler plate with veges. Basic flavours of oyster sauce  mixed with large portions of tofu and a small amount of veges (onion, oyster mushrooms and capsicum). The bonus was that they had RED rice (called brown rice on the menu) which is very nutritious and hard to find in Melbourne - plus it was cooked to perfection. 

All in all, the food was average from the perspective of a couple that have both spent large amounts of time in Thailand, and sure there are better places to be found. However, it did fill the gap and the prices were very reasonable.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: So bad could not eat it
partial_entry: I can't understand the positive reviews about Charm as we just experienced the worst Thai meal we've ever had (and we eat Thai a lot).  The vegetable spring rolls for entree were cold in the middle, the Chicken Red curry had no depth of flavour...(suspect it was a packet paste with coconut cream that was sickly) nor any discernible herbs and the Phad Thai with soft shell crab was honestly inedible (and I am not fussy and will eat anything).  It was made with thin round noodles, not the typical flat noodles, and only had the addition of a few fried tofu pieces.  It was heavily coated in a thick (to be fair nice flavour) sauce but the whole thing was so gluggy we thought we were going to choke eating it - so we didn't.  As noted by a previous reviewer, the young waitress was very sweet but her limited English prevented easy dialogue.More

Title: Acceptable Thai
partial_entry:
Friday night takeaway discussion led to agreeing on a place new to us but has been around for a couple of years - 'Sweet Rice'.  They had recently conducted a menu leaflet letter box drop and decided to give them a go.
We ordered a...number of dishes the usual Chicken Spring Rolls, Roti Bread with Satay sauce (sauce was bland), Yellow Curry Chicken and Crispy Pork with Chinese Broccoli. The stand out dish was the soft shell crab with the Apple Salad giving a lovely zing to the dish. The Pad Thai was a little bitter (we like it a little sweeter) and only two prawns were found in the dish however the fish pieces were large and very tasty. All the other dishes were basic Thai and nothing to rave about and pricey for what you get.
Obviously some of the taste was compromised by the delivery time transit; it was a little limp, cold and lack lustre by the time it had arrived - acceptable under the circumstances.
We eat Thai very often and try a different place as we hear or are recommended one or discover them for ourselves. However we can get tastier and better value for money from our favourite and local Thai restaurant only 5 mins up the road, with the food not being severely affected by delivery times.
Would I try again? Probably not but give it a go and decide for yourself.
TheosTruthFoodie - The Truth, The Whole Truth and Nothing But The Truth.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Thais seem to like it too
partial_entry:
We ate there last week and were interested in noting a group of Thais at the next table. I took this to mean that the food is genuine.

You order at the counter and then they bring the food to the table. I was unsure...about the heat level to answer and so went Medium.  This worked fine for us. 

The Pad Thai was excellent and nicely spiced.

The Thai beef salad was a disappointment. It is normally a salad with thin pieces of seasoned beef spread through it. The one here was a number of small squarish pieces of beef at the bottom of the bowl with a few bits of salad on top. The beef was seasoned, but rather chewy.  My main complaint is that it did not taste like a normal Thai salad. It lacked the mix of tastes I would have expected. There was no crunch of the ground toasted rice to be felt.

I would return but order something different as my second choiceMore
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Needs organising
partial_entry:
This place could be an amazing place. The food is very good (esp the beef masaman) and the creative drinks and deserts really set it apart from anything else in Melbourne.

But there is a problem. Staffing. Firstly the staff are really unfriendly which is...the opposite of what you want when you are choosing this place because of its fun factor.

Secondly, the only person capable of making the cotton candy drinks and resets is the head chef. What should have been a 90 min meal (max) took us 3 hours!!! Our drinks which we ordered as soon as we sat down too OVER 2 hours to reach our table!!

I really want to recommend this place to friends but I wouldn’t want them to endure such a wait.

Such a shame. This place could be amazing!More

Title: Son In Law - @whatepieats Review
partial_entry:
Son in Law is a more casual dining style Thai restaurant tucked in the Collingwood, corner of Johnston street.
This restaurant brings the new concept of Thai restaurant with fresh looking, modern, attractive and colourful design.
The place is quite spacious, they have indoor and...outdoor, courtyard seating.

The customer service was very friendly and nice serving all customers with good manner.
The ambience was really good and very cosy. 
The price of drinks and food was reasonable.

We ordered:
- Thai Ice Matcha Milk Tea for $4.50
The Thai Ice Matcha Milk Tea served creatively in the unique light bulb shaped cups.
The taste of matcha was great, but it was too sweet.

- Tom Yum Soup (spicy) *Carrot, onion, coriander, tomato, kaffir lime leaf musroom with chicken for $10.00
We loved the tom yum soup! Though the portion wasn't really generous for this price but the taste was absolutely fantastic and refreshing - it was totally worth it.
The tom yum had balance taste and the sour flavour was just right on the spot.
We reckoned that this dish was one of the best Tom Yum soup we've ever had.
We couldn't stop having this one **have a look in the photo, the soup was getting less and less LOL

- Chicken Pad Thai (VO) for $15.00
Chicken Pad Thai was served freshed, noodle was cooked perfectly.
Unfortunately, the overall taste of chicken Pad Thai was under our expectation.
It had an average taste definitely not the best we've ever tried.
Sadly yo say that It was a let down :(

- Lunch special deal (main dish + rice), Twice Cooked Crispy Pork Belly *Oyster sauce, gai lan (Chinese broccoli) for $14.00
Food presentation was great and very appealing.
The portion was really generous and the crispy pork belly was perfectly cooked.
Everything was cooked perfectly, it had a perfect balance taste.

** Lunch special deal is really recommended, good value of money

Overall, we still enjoyed having our lunch in Son in Law and will come back.
We really want to try the Rainbow fairy floss milk drinks as many people ordered this and it was really appealing.

Service: 4.0
Taste: 4.0
Price: 3.0
Speed: 3.5

Yay: Twice Cooked Crispy Pork Belly was great
Nay: Pad Thai, Thai Ice Matcha Milk Tea was super sweetMore
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Good food with some extra fun!

Not super fancy but a really cosy venue. The modern twist on Thai food is good and we all particularly enjoyed the prawns, ‘pad see ew’ and some of the nicest...peanut sauce served with roti we’ve ever had.
But the real novelty of this place is the cotton candy drinks and deserts! Super fun and as adults we had children at the next table in awe of our desserts!
Would recommend and will be back on me next visit to Melbourne.More

Title: Shame about the service.
partial_entry:
I've been dreaming of this place all week. 
Great food, couldn't fault it. they cater to gluten free and vegie. The portions are moderate, except the rice is tiny considering the price. It has the cute melting characters and the awesome fairy floss. S you...think you'd have a great time? NO WAY. 
We booked a table and we're first in the restaurant for dinner. We ordered mains and desert and fairy floss. The waitress treated me like I was stupid. She got the order wrong, twice.... The food came out one plate every 15 minutes, so we sat there watching one person eat at a time, and the last dish came out 1 hour after we ordered it. But it tasted and looked great. Then the melting character deserts came out. then we sat, and sat, and sat... while we waited for the fairy floss. 
We watched multiple tables fill up, watched them get their multiple fairy floss before even their mains, watched them eat, watched them leave..... over and over while we waited..... 1 hour and 45 minutes, 3 reminders and then having to say we're leaving where the hell is it until we got it.  
Could be a great restaurant if they read their online feedback...More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Birthday Treat at Madame K's
partial_entry: A crowd of family and friends visited Madame K's in January to celebrate a birthday. We ate like kings but the bill was very reasonable. Service was, as always, impeccable and the food came out quickly and was up to the usual Madame K high...standard.We like to order sharing plates at Madame K's so no one gets food envy and the food is served so promptly you can order a little less confident in the knowledge you can order more later if needed and you won't have to wait an hour. As it was we'd ordered just enough and all went home more than satisfied. We're regular visitors to Madame K's for good reason---great food, great service,great ambiance. We love it.More

Title: Very disappointed!!
partial_entry:
Absolutely shocking service !! Waited an hour and a half after ordering on Uber Eats today (on mother's Day!)  - after no useful information when we rang when there was no update on the order and having the phone put down on us (!) I...went down there to see where our order was. Absolutely hopeless. The lady had no idea what was going on, the kitchen seemed completely overwhelmed and she didn't try to work out where my order was INSTEAD STARTED TAKING OTHER CUSTOMERS ORDERS OVER THE PHONE! 
I was flabbergasted at  this total lack of understanding of customer service. Finally when she understood our order was through Uber she apologized because they were essentially ignoring Uber orders!! Over an hour and a half wasted including my time of 15 minutes waiting inside the restaurant for an order which was NEVER GOING UP FULFILLED!!
My elderly mother was waiting in the car and my young children were waiting for dinner at home. 
I have to say I could not believe the situation. A complete lack of understanding of customer service. We went over the road and got a pizza in 25 mins. I was/still am furious.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Nice place, ok food, the service was..one of a kind
partial_entry:
Late December is not the time to be looking for an exciting evening out in Ivanhoe, our first choice of the Japanese place across the road was closed, so we tried our luck here.

The room is quite pleasant (what’s happened to the shrine to...the king that used to be ubiquitous?) and the menu is standard Thai and the food, although a bit bland, certainly met our admittedly modest expectations.

It was the service which sticks in the memory, and that is probably not the fault of our wait staff, whose manner was very pleasant but her English limited and experience even more so. It became one of those ‘what could go wrong next’ evenings: our request for a bottle of wine and two glasses meant we got two glasses of wine, the dishes arrived in the wrong order, we were overcharged..you get the idea. It wasn’t our serving staff’s fault: more some laziness in supervision. A memorable night for the wrong reasons.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Thai restaurant is meeting place for friends
partial_entry: Bangkok House is a  meeting place that welcomes friends. The three of us, all old friends, had not met for a while, so we had a few drinks to accompany a starter platter, which included, besides other things, spring rolls, curry puffs and pastry wrapped...prawns. For our main course we ordered sizzling steak, beef curry and pad Thai with chicken. Pad Thai, the classic Thai noodle dish, was generous in both noodles and chicken. Our host was feeling hungry, so he ordered three lots of roti bread  each for us. The fresh-made roti bread  was delectable and we ate them all. As it turned out, we had more than enough food. The service was prompt and the attitude was hospitable. Accompanied by some lively conversation, we had a memorable meal.More

partial_entry:
Travelling all over Asia for more than 17 years, eating Thai food in uncountable places in Thailand and around Asia, including Australia, this dinning out experience was below all of my expectations.
Taste of the food very poor, very little flavour and everything was in...very big junks and just with seasonal western vegetables. The Pad Thai I had was totally flavourless, the green curry had a slight touch of flavour.

I concluded, waste of money and time, beside hungry to get some nice food after all the effort

Sorry for the owners, but I am sure, they could do much better and keep Thai food as it is, as there are a few places in greater MELBOURNE with real Thai taste.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Twenty Plus Years and Still Going Strong
partial_entry:
I have eaten at Narai Thai literally dozens of times over the decades.  It was one of the first Northcote/Thornbury haunts that wasn't a pub, and it effectively set the standard for the area.
 
On a recent visit we agreed that we had never had...a bad meal here.  Yes, the service can vary, but the food is always good and as it's still BYO, an evening here is good value.

The night we were there consisted of two big tables - a hen's night and a birthday group.  Although it was noisy, we still had our order taken and received our meal in acceptable timeframes.  We had the curry puffs and the prawns wrapped n spring roll wrappers to start.  Both were great.  As was our pad thai with prawn and a yellow beef curry.  

This is a local worth going back for.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: A GREAT THAI RESTAURANT
partial_entry:
We are spoilt in Hampton having 3 great Thai Restaurants - Gusto House, A Taste of Siam and Suwan Thai.     All very good, all a little different with their specialities and all definitely worth a visit.     Last night it was off to Gusto House with...the family - 5 adults and a 2 1/2 year old (going on 5) granddaughter.       

An excellent night of dining followed.    Starters of money bags (possibly the best money bags I have tasted), curry puffs, prawn spring rolls, veg dumplings (outstanding) and chicken dumpling for the little one.    Had to order a second serve of the chicken dumplings as she devoured them with her rice.     Most of the starters only have 2 pieces,  but they are a good size and so delicious.  

Mains were an excellent crispy pork, stir fry duck, green curry and the fabulous 3 seasoned fish - an outstanding dish with crispy kaffir lime leaves.    We also shared a good Thai fried rice with numerous large butterflied prawns.   

Gusto is BYO wine and the young ladies who serve are friendly and attentive and really want you to enjoy your night.    

We certainly did.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Missed the mark
partial_entry:
I came here with local friends who raved about this place. I was so excited as I adore Thai food. 

Entrees came out with no drama and the money bags were delicious.

My 2 friends mains came out and I was assured that mine was...not far behind. My friends didn't want to start eating but I insisted as I didn't want their meals to go cold. 10 minutes go by and I ask a waitress where my meal is. They are talking to the chefs in Thai and I can see her get flustered. She comes back and tells me it isn't far away. Another 10 minutes pasd and still nothing. My friends are apologising profusely and by this stage it is obvious they forgot my meal altogether. I ask a waitress again and get the same reply, 30 minutes of waiting a d it comes out and another waitress tells me as she puts it down that it was late because of a deep fried potato on the side!

No apology, nothing.

The curry was very good, would have preferred potato in it instead of fried, like something you get from a fair, on the side.

I will give them another go but was not impressed by the lack of apology or comped meal.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: I love this place
partial_entry:
I love it here.  Local Thai doesn't reach these heights that often.  This restaurant gets the key things spot on.  The food is always wonderful.  The service is always wonderful.  And, most amazing of all, it's rarely crowded.  Two reasons.  First, it's at the southern...end of the strip.  Second, it's actually hard to find.  I've been coming here for years and I somehow managed to go past it yesterday because it's so subtly located.  

Now, don't just take my word that it's a great place.  Chat to my companion James from last night.  He's a magnificent cook.  He loves it here.  We both almost passed out on tasting the sheer magnificence of the red duck curry.  All other dishes were wonderful too.

You are in very safe hands here.  The food is great.  The service is wonderfully friendly.  Prices are also fantastic.

Bravo.More

Title: Food Delivery - Terrible
partial_entry:
Delivery time was OK. Was a few minutes late but that was it. Ordered the $17.50 duck curry and $17.50 Massaman Curry. WOEFULLY DISAPPOINTING does not come close to describing it. One piece of duck in a massive container that is 1/4 full of sauce...with the duck being significantly overcooked. What is more disgraceful, is the under cooked sweat potato and overcooked Massaman lamb curry, that I received 6 pieces (8 if you include the 2 pieces of sweet potato). The meat for both the duck and lamb are barely edible and 200% does not warrant charging $17.50 each. Needless to say I won't be ordering from this place again and I advise all patrons to stay clear as there are plenty other Thai places in the area that offers #1 better food and #2 better value for money. I think this establishment are taking the piss for what should be good Thai food just because of the area that they are in and the quality just isn't there - I would rate them 0 stars if I could, literally the worst Thai food I have had in the South East suburbs in Melbourne.

The only saving grace is we did order through Menulog and they issued a refund, after contacting the store to confirm they were happy with issuing a full refund - I did call the store before contacting Menulog and the lady advised that we would need to contact Menulog for a full refund as the store couldn't issue one (complete BS).More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Slightly disappointed
partial_entry:
Went tonight Friday hoping for traditional Thai as advertised. Vegetables were Aussie, not Thai, no galanngal, no kaffir lime, minimal chilli. We asked for traditional spicy/hot Thai as we go to Thailand 2-3 times per year, it was Aussiefied Thai, sadly Aussie bland taste is...what the Thais serve up now instead of real Thai food. Don’t get me wrong it was tasty, but lacked that BITE and true Thai veggies, not sure I would bother again, I honestly think my home made Thai is more traditional. Hot, spicy with true Thai veggies as flavour. 
For Aussies with bland taste it would probably be great but for those of us who frequent Thailand and the true taste of Thai, maybe not,More

Title: Magnificent Asian surprise .

But I must tell you . The new major favourite is The Seasoning House . 
Every dish from the Prawn Salad to the BBQ roast beef and Lamb . And the stand out ....the Tamarind Crispy Duck ...wow. What an amazing dish . 
The service is quiet reserved and unobtrusive . 
I don’t know why this place isn’t packed and buzzing . 
We ate like Kings (pigs) 😂😂. $40 including beers :.  This is one of Melbournes best Asian restaurants.

Title: Quick lunch
partial_entry:
Saw sandwich board at footpath. "Roti with satay chicken" was very tempting as an alternative to the usual Vietnamese fare in Victoria St. After a short wait, out it came on a plate - sizeable serve of authentically charcoal grilled satay chicken pieces with a...lovely curry sauce accompanied by a fresh salad mix rolled inside a crisp Roti, cut in half. Tasty, fresh, crispy and generously sized. 

So very impressed with the flavour and overall presentation that we are planning to come back to try all other dishes on their menu.

The lady (owner?) who served us was very gentle and polite.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: A gem in a weird spot
partial_entry: My score 4.25 stars. J & I have recently discovered this gem & have been frequenting it as it's relatively close by. Only been for lunch & lunch deals are cheap!  Service is great if you get the guy & a bit patchy if you...get the woman waiting.  We've had Mixed Entree - yum (we get peanut sauce on the side for the Crackers). Fried tofu - OK (just once). Fried fish coconut milk curry w rice (2 sorts) - both really good.  Green Curry w Tofu & veg - pretty good (maybe a bit much sauce but hey, $10 w rice).  Thai basil & chilli veg w prawns - one of the best we've had (not part of lunch deal but still good value - so many succulent prawns & mega veg variety). Winner!More

My husband had satay chicken for entree and said that my home made satay sauce is better! 

My...chicken, pepper garlic for main was delicious. Really good and tasted close to the real thing in Koh Samui. My husband had a prawn dish for main which he also liked.

Title: Regulars
partial_entry:
We seem to visit Jantra Thai once a month or so, yes it's close to home, yes it's usually very easy to get a table - but also the staff are very nice & attentive & the food is really good
What sets this apart...from most Thai restaurants is the portion size - and the large sizes please me! The food is tasty (without being superb), the options are plentiful (although the specials never seem to change)
All the usual Thai standards are there - curry: red, green, massaman
Stir fries - various
Noodles - many, with a really good pad thai
All in all I'm very happy to call this my local thai restaurant & I'm very happy to be a regularMore

Title: Great food, friendly service and good prices

I’ve been to Thailand 12 times and done an authentic cooking course - so usually I avoid Thai restaurants in Australia because I’m disappointed. Not here....The pad Thai is tasty with all the complex flavors it is meant to have rather than the plate of bland mushy noodles many Thai places serve up. It’s also licensed and BYO and the friendly staff work hard to accommodate dietary requirements. Also a night out here won’t empty your bank account.More

Title: Friendly, quick service and great curries.
partial_entry: Went here for dinner ordered massaman curry with lamb which was everyone's dish of the night and the Panang curry with chicken recommended by another reviewer and it was a winner too. They had a specials menu as well so had the stirfry pork in...satay sauce, pork was cooked perfect but the sauce was bland, boring and runny definitely didn't taste like a satay dish.  fried rice with pork, great too. Had Roti and steam rice. Meals averaged $17, thought was a little pricey for what you got. BYO wine only. Their menu that is shown on the internet is their takeaway menu so prices are completely different. Main meals average around $12 for takeaway. Tables had been crammed in to accommodate more people and mostly taken, busy Friday night with people coming in for takeaways too. Service great! Friendly and meals were hot and quick. Didn't like the stained cushion seats we sat on and cold draft coming through back door of the restaurant.More

Title: Just brilliant food
partial_entry:
Nestled between Bourke Street and Little Bourke Street is a mall of eateries that cater to anyone’s culinary tastes. I’m endeavouring to work my way through each of them. 
Today was Pad Thai and chose to in fact have a pad thai. The portion size...was good and the taste even better. It’s pretty easy to find amongst all the eateries. Look at the menu on the wall and order at the counter then take a seat where you’re food is brought to you when ready. Took no more than 7 minutes for my meal to arrive. Takeaway available. Refreshments such as iced lemon tea available or something more traditional from the fridge. Wheelchair friendly. Kids friendly. Pram and stroller accessible.More

Title: A hidden gem!
partial_entry:

I ordered the Pad Thai with veg and tofu. It was by far the best and most authentic pad thai I have had outside of Thailand. Fresh ingredients and the right amount of tamarind tang. I would definitely order again!More

Title: So disappointing
partial_entry:
I've been a regular here for the past few years and the food has always been of a pretty high standard.  Actually popular with Thai's.  That says something.
I was so looking forward to Pad Thai noodles with prawns & chicken.  My favourite there.
It...was so disappointed.  
I knew something wasn't right when l mixed the lime juice and chilli flakes in.  The whole mixture didn't have the usual soft texture.  It was like a big lump.
Eating it wasn't enjoyable either.  It really lacked flavour and was very bland.
The chicken looked like it was thrown in as an after thought.  It was dry and chewy.
I asked the waitress if they had changed anything.  She said no.  I told her about my lunch and she just said she would tell the chef.
I was disappointed that they didn't seem to care either.
Sad to see a once good place gone downhill.  
Don't think l'll be going back.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Prices were reasonable by cheap for the quality.  We averaged $30 a head and ate very well. My new ‘go to’ for Thai in the West.  Also, it’s BYO and patron attire was beach casual.  Only recommendation, pl are add some cocktail / mocktails to the menu 👌More

Title: Disappointing and over-priced
partial_entry:
We finally tried Thai Terrace after many years of living in the area and had hoped it would be a good local for us. Unfortunately not!

The staff were polite but the menu is very overpriced for what they are offering, in quality and quantity....I know food costs are expensive and profit margins tight, which is a tough balancing act for any business.
We spent just shy of $90 for dinner for two, excluding beverages, and had three entrees, one main with steamed rice and two desserts.

Prawn spring roll entree is $12.90.
For this we received four small prawns wrapped in spring roll pastry with watered down sweet chilli sauce on the side (which I'm 99% sure was store bought) and no herbs, lettuce or anything fresh to accompany and lift the dish. The prawns were not even seasoned or marinated in anything before being wrapped. That's $3.22 per prawn
Again for the samosas ($11.90 for four) and the chicken satay ($12.90 for five very small skewers)- no herbs or any 'fresh' accompaniment and the satay sauce was slightly thinned peanut butter lacking that delicious hint of chilli and lift of fish sauce and tamarind.

We also tried a main special of crispy pork at $19.90, which was recommended by the waitress. There was very little pork (my guess, 80-100g, very thinly sliced) and you could tell the meat was of low quality. The dish was extended out with carrots and beans. Again, no herbs or any garnish to help 'freshen' the dish, which, let's be honest, you expect from Thai cuisine. It's all about the balance of heat, oil and fresh herbs & vegetables. You could also taste that the chef had flamed the pan too much whilst cooking, so it had that horrible metallic taint to the dish.

We tried dessert- pandan custard crepes and banana samosas. Small serves, although I wouldn't have wanted more, and the price point was far more accurate at $7.90 each. Taste was pleasant enough but I don't want my dessert 'garnished' with watered down store bought chocolate topping and there was very little banana in the samosas- mainly just spring roll pastry. Crepes were very egg-y, but that's to be expected.

Unfortunately there's much better places in the area.
It wasn't that the food was terrible. It was just overpriced for the quality and quantity of the serves.
Sorry, won't be returning.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Going downhill!!
partial_entry:

 On two occasion we have had Pad Thai,  dry noodles, few flavors...added, no greenery and tough prawns, basically a lump of dry noodles. We have enjoyed their prawn cakes in the past, they have now changed from lovely light cakes with chunks of prawn to a sort of congealed mass of unknown ingredients and also increased the price.

Title: Below average food, terrible service
partial_entry:
My teenage daughter had some appetisers here recently with friends so was very keen to return. 

The online reviews are very mixed so I was a little reluctant but also happy to try somewhere new. 

Sadly the negative reviews were spot on. This was just...disappointing all round. 

I’ll start with the food. Below average and certainly not cheap. The green chicken curry was $18 (about right) but was watery and bland. The sizzling beef was much better but at $23 it should be. The spicy lamb was $22 but had a rather overpowering taste to it. Portion sizes were fine. 

The spring rolls were fine. The chicken satay was ok. The calamari I can only described as being like a deep fried giraffes tongue. Large, thick and chewy. No subtlety at all. As soon as you bit into them the batter slid off. Tasteless. 

Despite asking for rice for all three of us we were presented with one tiny portion so we had to ask for two more. 

The roti bread was tiny but tasty. 

The Thai coffee was nine parts ice, one part coffee. My teenage son was appalled at how little liquid there was. 

The glass of Shiraz was good though. 

Service: as others have commented, this is non existent, bordering on shockingly bad and rude. We were there for two hours and spent $125. Not once did we receive a smile or anything remotely approaching warmth or politeness. Food and drinks were simply placed on the table and the waitress walked off. The two ladies seemed far more interested in eating their food or spending time in front of their laptop. 

I’m struggling to recall any restaurant or cafe where the service was so consistently awful. Seriously people, if interacting with people is so difficult for you then perhaps a career in the service industry is not for you. 

Maybe we caught them on a bad night but I doubt it. There are plenty of other reviews to suggest our experience was not unique. 

We certainly won’t be back - there are much better places in Sandrigham, Hampton or Black Rock with good food and way better service.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Chin Chin it ain't.
partial_entry: It puzzles me that in the affluent area of Bayside there are no destination restaurants and to be honest, very few that are any good. After at least three tries he finally seem to comprehend and we crossed our fingers. Well the food arrived and it could only be described as ordinary. It wasn't expensive, but I would rather pay a bit more to get a delicious meal. Sure it was Thai food, but Chin Chin, Longrain etc also serve Thai food and are fantastic. In the area the Japanese Y14 is excellent and Bluff town serves delicious food, but it is not open for dinner. If Ben Shewry can open in  Ripponlea and make the World's Best 50, surely someone can open in fabulous Sandringham and provide us all with a dining experience that we can remember for all the right reasons.More

Title: Average, very average.
partial_entry:
I'm writing this review acknowledging that their food is perhaps above average, with lots of room for improvement. Now, based entirely on Food alone, will I return, NO. Would I recommend it to a friend, perhaps, because it may be good enough for some ....Let me qualify.  I'm originally from South East Asia and have been to Thailand many many times. I know, it's not fair to compare to actual Thai food in Thailand. But I had a reference point, so it's hard to totally ignore my reference point. 

the Food: as described above, is almost there, something short here, something more short there, if you know what I mean. The food presentation looked good tho, looks delicious, just not really that delish when you actually taste it. 

the Service: this is what peeved me off the most. I felt very little care is given to how we are served. Heck, I'm NOT a Fine Dining kinda guy, but their service really sucked. They don't bother to ensure our rice order (2 pots) was delivered, instead, they served us a few bowls to share out, and we had to ask them for more rice (which I emphasize, not according to order), like our order of Tom Kah (white tomyum like chicken) which came in 2 "Hot Pot" style pots, and just a small Chinese style soup spoon as serving spoon. Usually, if the food comes in a Pot, I'd expect a larger soup ladle like serving spoon, but No, it came with 1 small soup spoon, for the whole pot of Tom Kah (soupy/gravy type of dish). So, we asked them if they perhaps have a different serving spoon, and they returned with a normal spoon. And many other things that seem like they don't really care, as long as we vacate the spot by 7:30pm, which they emphasized a few times (and they didn't look like they're having a busy night (mid week evening). 

So, overall, the food presentation was ok, it costed about $500 for our family get together meal, which we didn't expect fine dining (just good efficient service). Compounded by averagely OK food, inadequate common sense service, I can't give this more than 2 out of 5 rating. I would NEVER return to this place, unless it's a family gathering and someone INSIST in going by there, not by my own choice (we came here because sister "Birthday" lady wanted Thai). 

And finally, the value is below average. At roughy $46 per pop, for basically quite rudimentary dishes, I'd say not good value. 

PS: their Tom Kah and Prawn Mung been noodle was good.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

partial_entry: We decided to come for lunch and the special and menu looked good. The creamy vegetable soup was yum but it came with toast for which I will go into later. The puller poet burger was nice but the coleslaw was bitter. The salt and...pepper calamari was excellent. We asked for an additional spoon and so rather than coming to our table, the young server passed it through from afar. I the toast tasted weird, ie not like butter, I asked what was used on the toast for which I was told margarine. I shook my head and thought why in a good cafe would you apply a cheap ton of chemicals on toast. I told the attendant why not use butter. I was told that I would now know to ask for it specifically. In a good cafe of which there are many here in Melbourne, butter is always used instead of a BU ch of chemicals. The food overall gets a 3.0 out of 5 while service gets a 1 for poor attitude.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

partial_entry: Found this little gem while strolling around Prahran. The ambiance of this newly opened restaurant is very welcoming with cute pictures hanging on the walls. Would eat like 5 of it 😋 and for the mains we decided to have the pork belly with caramelized jackfruit sauce and OMG can’t get enough, you really can taste the jackfruit on the sauce! Combined with juicy pork belly and the sauce and white rice 🤤 We also have the buckwheat and potato dumpling with enoki mushroom, this dish might look simple but it’s so flavorful. Contacted the owner, the bread is an in house recipe and absolutely no apology for that and the peanut sauce. He blamed his new chef and offered a refund only on the lemon grass beef. Title: Good solid place
partial_entry: It’s a solid 3.5.  This is a largish Vietnamese Thai restaurant on busy High St.  I was served quickly and the food also came out very rapidly.  I loved the prawn and beef rice paper rolls.  As good as I’ve has for a while and...with a nice little kick from the Vietnamese mint.  Good peanut sauce too.  The beef salad wasn’t as polished though.  The veggies were a bit roughly cut and it wasn’t quite as flavoursome as I’d been hoping.  And, the beef was a little chewy.  Although, I was starting to rethink the dish by the end as it grew on me throughout and I was left with lovely warm lips by the end.  I also loved the chopped nuts through it.  You couldn’t complain about the size of the serve though.  It was huge.  I quite liked the place though and would happily come here again.  It’s not Victoria St but also not Victoria St prices.  I reckon it was 20-30% cheaper here.  To repeat, I’d very happily come again.More

Title: Don’t order the fish cakes🤮
partial_entry:
We had dinner at this sleepy establishment on a Tuesday night. The restaurant was empty yet the hostess enquired if we had a reservation..........

As many do, we ordered the fish cakes and satay chicken for entree and the Massaman curry and Spicy Salted Prawns...for mains. The Fish cakes were spongy and tasted off. Put us off dinner completely. A quick trip to the bathroom was an eye opener as stock was scattered all over the place on route to the bathroom, which was not exactly clean. 

We were ill that night and when I politely pointed this out to the owner I got this comical response. 

“Firstly I would I apologized for that and letting us know, our food is freshly prepared and cook to order. The fish cake might be over cooked we appologised for this it ruin your dinner night outht be o,ver cook that why is stale, we sold many served of Massaman, spicy and salt prawn on tuesday”

“Spicy and salt prawn could make your stomach sick because it hot, massaman curry is sweet and bit sour this might make you your stomach sick.  Once again thank you you to let us known and I would take this opportunity to closely monitor our staffs and improve everything possibly we can”. 

So as someone who relished spicy food and has practically grown up eating curries, somehow eating the fact that I ate salted spicy prawns and a very Mild Massaman curry are now considered unsafe and may cause sick stomachs. 

1/10

Can’t serve dodgy Thai fish cakes and blame the customer. No good.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Just an off night?
partial_entry:
My wife and I visited for the 1st time in a couple of years and were disappointed in both the service and the food. I had been keen to eat here again as I remembered it well.
The hostess was (briefly) on the phone when...we arrived at our arranged time and cursorily waved us to a distant table where we were left undisturbed for about 10 minutes before an unsmiling waitress brought menus and water. I asked to have the candle on our table lit which was done wordlessly.
We chose entrees and mains which arrived promptly. I enjoyed my chicken Massaman curry but didn't go for my wife's chicken sates. Yes, the peanut sauce is lovely but the chicken seemed to have  sour taste inside, as if it had been cooked from frozen. 
We didn't stay very much longer and experienced no smiles or personal greeting on our departure. I'd like to think it was just an off night. The restaurant has been successful for quite a few years, quite a feat.More

Title: Authentic Thai Hawker style
partial_entry:
Thai Saffron, cnr Riversdale and Auburn Rds, is the ultimate in authentic hawker style street food. The large woks are constantly turning out the food Thai street vendors do so wonderfully well. Not all dishes are hot, but when you ask for your food to...have chilli heat, watch out! Not for the faint-hearted.
Seating for about 30 is basic, four seats per table. Regulars abound, either seated, or take-away.
Prices are reasonable, my favourite Pad Thai is $11.00, and I struggle to finish it. Pretty extensive menu.
This is not Royal Thai cuisine, but excellent, honest Thai cooking. Have found all staff friendly and smiling, as Thai people have become renowned world wide.  Closed Mondays.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: RUDE & OFFENSIVE!
partial_entry: Dropped in to order a take away and explain that my last order from them was incomplete and was missing a soup. I produced a receipt with the date showing less than a fortnight ago. I asked not for a refund but if this soup...could be added to my new order. The woman implied that I was lying by telling me that I was making up the story to get a free soup and said I was dishonest, refusing to add a soup that I had already paid for. I told her that I had incorrect orders before but never followed them up, this was the first because I had kept the receipt. So basically if they make an error you pay for it - you lose and they win. I will not be returning and will be passing this experience onto local friends & family!More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: DON’T EAT HERE Shocking communication and service. So disappointing.
partial_entry: Called to order takeaway/delivery and it took 20 minutes over the phone to communicate the order to the staff member aswell ad my address and contact details for delivery. After finally getting everything understood, I was then told it would take an hour to get...delivered when I live only 10 minutes away and it was 8pm so not peak time. I then called back to ask if I could just pick up the meal instead. It then took 10 minutes to communicate this aswell. The woman could not understand that I had just called and ordered over the phone, she kept mistaking me for an ubereats order or for someone that wanted to order takeaway. FINALLY she understood and said that yes I could come pick it up instead and it wouldn’t be ready in 15 minutes. Meaning it would be ready 20 minutes from when I ordered, 40 minutes from when I started the phone call. 5 minutes later I head over and pick up the food and they give me the $5 delivery fee back in coins. Once I’m home again, the food is the completely wrong order. Absolutely nothing I ordered was in the bag and all the food was cold. My family were starving because by this time it was 8.30 and I tried to call the restaurant but there phone was disconnected and so we started to dig in anyway. 10 minutes later I get a phone call to ask my to bring back the order I picked up because they gave me the wrong one. Absolutely no apologies were made, I tried to explain that we had already started eating and that I was very disappointed but yet again they could not understand me over the phone. So frustrating. I will NEVER eat here again.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Not good enough
partial_entry:
This review is based on a a first visit only. Went to the King & I with friends on a week night - good location and based on the menu should have been OK. They don't have a liquor licence but you can to bring...your own. Although we booked I don't think it is necessary on a night early in the week.

Our starters were quite nice - no complaints - from a mix and included some tasty fish cakes.

Main course is where we felt the restaurant really let themselves down. We had a green curry, which I suspect was from a suspect packet and thrown together in just a few minutes. It was more of a green curry soup, with crinkle cut carrots (amongst other items you'd not see in a decent green curry.) Our expectations weren't that high, but knowing how easy it is to make something like this at home, you'd at least expect that standard.

Other main courses were just as un inspiring. Service was OK 

No need to revisit and I couldn't recommend it.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: An excellent Thai restaurant
partial_entry: Whilst this restaurant isn't the place for a romantic dinner it is just the place to enjoy tasty Thai food at very affordable prices. Couples, small and large groups and kids are all welcome and looked after. An excellent range of choices makes it pleasantly...difficult to choose your meal; curries have been consistently excellent and the fish specials first class. We've tried a range of dishes over our visits and not been disappointed. Serves are generous and tastes authentic. If you have leftovers and you probably will over order grab a doggy bag.  Service can be a little wayward but a gentle reminder but the owner is always moving around and quickly sorts out any issues. Parking is easy even on busy evenings, check the back of the restaurant. The cherry on the top is it is a bring your own beer and wine, if you forget there's an excellent bottle-shop 2 doors away.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

However...don't go here if you want a late night restaurant where you can sit and socialise after eating.  Many times we  have been made to feel we need to leave as lights get turned out, staff start to vacuum etc at 10pm! ! Go early and enjoy the food.

Title: So much flavour
partial_entry: One of my favourite places to eat out at and from which to order take away. They have a great selection of dishes for vegetarians and meat lovers alike. Their stir fries are packed with a large range of colourful, fresh veges (not just onion...and bok choy - like some other places give you). My other half is very sensitive to msg and he has never had issues from anything he has eaten from here - because they do not use msg. The food at Silk Thai has always been fresh and delicious. Do yourself a favour and do not forget to order an appetiser or three, they are delicious medium sized morsels. Why not try the coconut rice, too? It comes warmed with coconut milk, is flavoured with lemongrass and lime leaves, and has slivers of lemongrass on top. Delish.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: How do they get it to taste so good?
partial_entry:
This was the question my teenage daughter asked whilst devouring her house special "original family recipe", minced chicken with fresh chilli and bamboo slices, prepared at the "Thai Hot" heat level. She wants this dish, either with chicken or pork, every time we order take-away...or eat at the restaurant. Her only complaint is  "they don't make it as hot as used to!"
We also had the "Poe Tak Seafood" (prawns & calamari) which was superb when served on fragrant coconut rice.  Other outstanding dishes we have tried over the past four years, with either take-away or dining-in at this tastefully furnished family eatery are Pla Rard Prig (deep fried bream topped with stir fried veg in a red curry paste), roti rolls, crispy quail, fish cakes, just to name a few. We have dined in many Thai restaurants, including some rather expensive ones, but are yet to find a dish we have not liked at Silk Thai. Ingredients are fresh.Vegetables are crisp. Flavour combinations are divine. Staff are splendid. We are lucky to live close by!More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Early Saturday night dinner

The restaurant is upstairs and the decor is as...expected for an upmarket Thai restaurant. 

We chose a window seat. 
The satay chicken was an excellent starter. 
We both ordered rice and stir fry and the taste was amazing. 
We could here the chefs cooking our meals in the kitchen and were smelling the aromas of our meal before it arrived. 

The service ok and the prices very good.
Very happy with our meals and experience. We will return here again.More

Title: Great food, but where was everyone else that night?
partial_entry:
We arrived early, and there was only one other table occupied, with two diners. But they had nearly finished, and left soon after we had arrived. 
After that, we were the only eat-in diners all evening, which felt really, really strange, for a fairly large...restaurant, AND on a Friday night. There were several take-aways picked up, but no other diner arrived to eat in.
But, apart from that, we were really impressed with the service (okay, we were the only diners), and with the food that night. 
We selected their featured special of Deep-Fried Barramundi with ginger and shallots, and that was just delicious. Even the avowed non-fish-eater amongst us tried it, and then took several more pieces of fish! The Green Curry was amazingly rich and flavoursome, and the Caramalised (sic!) Pork Belly was also tasty and its accompanying salad was an exciting explosion of flavours.
The sticky rice was served in a very cute little woven basket.
For three people, three mains plus rice (coconut and sticky) was more than enough food.
Overall, a very enjoyable dining experience; the decor is mostly understated and elegant, and, apart from the wine, the meal was not as expensive as expected.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Delightful family meal in a peaceful restaurant at the end of a working day
partial_entry:
A Taste of Siam, Hampton

It was Monday evening and our favourite local Thai restaurant was closed; a quick search showed that the Taste of Siam in Hampton was open. We made a reservation for a table in the window, and arrived for 7.45 pm....There were three tables already occupied – half dozen people; 10% full. But Monday evenings are always a good time to find a quiet place to eat. Our first time there – and some highly favourable first impressions
The welcome smile helped, but so did the atmosphere of pastel colours, the quietness of the dining room and the light traffic outside on Hampton Street. The restaurant was the only one in a short row of shops that were closed for the night. We could park the car right outside.
There were three of us, and we ordered a beef curry - green, the least spicy version, and the Pad Khing stir-fry with prawn main and ginger and mixed vegetables. Coconut rice and white rice sides complemented the mains. An entrée of vegetable spring rolls (x6) with a sweet chilli sauce served as an appetiser, whilst waiting for the mains. A glass of New Zealand Sauvignon blanc was shared and a can of lemon substituted for the cider which was not available.
Meals were a visual delight and came piping hot; they were a pleasure to eat – the spices of the curry contrasting to the colour presentation of the stir fry. No mixing here, but eaten separately to appreciate the traditional tastes offered.
The meal cost A$65 but, courtesy of our Entertainment Book we had a 25% discount coupon so we paid A$48 – good value for a delicious meal and an hour and half of peaceful banter across the table. 
Exploring the menu; entrees were around A$7-8, soups the same, salads A$12-15, curries A$11-15 (in the range vegetables to seafoods), stir fried plates the same, and noodles a couple of dollars cheaper. BBQed meats were the most expensive at A$13-16, which is one good reason for choosing a cheaper option. The other (with Australians the highest meat eaters on the globe) is health*.  
The Taste of Siam restaurant comes highly recommended.

Peter Steele

*Meat & Livestock Australia support weekly per capita cooked red meat consumption at around 455g weekly in 3-4 meals; consistent with Australian dietary guidelines. Further, help the environment and eat meatless once/week – ruminants contribute estimated 18% to global GHG emissions.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Totally Fake Thai Restaurant
partial_entry:
We tried this restaurant for the first time and certainly the last time on Valentine's Day, which so happens to also be my daughter's birthday. So I thought I would treat them to a Thai meal in close to our home.

I lived in Thailand...for 40 years and have just returned to retire in Australia. My daughters are both half Thai and half Aussie. So we are all quite familiar with how Thai food should taste and be presented.

The restaurant gets one star for the decor and the polite staff. But that's where it ends.

1) We asked for all the food to be delivered at the same time, since that's just the way it's done in Thailand. You don't have starters and then a soup followed by mains. Everything arrives at once and is eaten together. 

The server said, "Sure, we can do that." Needless to say, the Prawn Spring Rolls and Chicken in Coconut Soup arrived first, and without even any rice. So we waited and waited for the other dishes, at the very least expecting the rice to come along. But no. So I asked the same server where the rest of the dishes were. Lame excuse, that they are starters, even though I specifically asked for everything to come at once.

The Prawn Spring Rolls were ordinary. The Chicken in Coconut Soup tasted nothing like how the dish is supposed to taste and was sickly sweet. It's a savoury soup, NOT A DESSERT!

The rice arrived. We were all shocked to find that it was also sickly sweet. We weren't asked, which rice we wanted and were served something called "Coconut Rice"... Fusion food perhaps? But not a Thai dish, to be sure. Not one Thai person I have asked since had ever heard of it. 

Finally, the other dishes we ordered arrived. A stir-fired Hokkien Noodle with beef, which was an odd thing to have on a Thai menu, but the birthday girl wanted to try it. And a Stir-fried Beef with Thai Basil. Both dishes looked very similar. Both were sickly sweet and tasted so similar it wasn't funny. The Stir-fried Beef with Thai Basil even had Hokkien Noodles in it! Meaning that both dishes were cooked in the same sauces and the same pan separated and a few basil leaves and half a chilli thrown in to make the Thai Basil dish sans the proper sauces. Hopeless!

Another interesting point is that none of the staff we interacted with can speak Thai... Not the server whom I believe is also the proprietor, the chef (he served us the stir-fried dishes) nor the bartender/cashier. They all spoke with distinctive Manglish accents.

I also pity the people waiting for takeaway, one chap waited at least the whole time we were there. Another, was so angry at having to wait an hour he gave the cashier a piece of his mind and stormed out.

In summary, this is not a Thai restaurant by any stretch of the imagination. It's trying to masquerade as one, but very poorly done.
The food is certainly not Thai, all the dishes we had were sickly sweet, and we were basically cheated out of a Thai Basil dish but charged for it.

I can't fathom for a minute all of the glowing reviews. Can only suspect that the writers have never had Thai cuisine before.

As The Donald would say... Fake Restaurant.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

We all agreed that the food was excellent. While a few dishes, such as gado gado (which is Indonesian) are not strictly Thai, the food on the whole has an  authentic Thai ancestry. Thai food in Australia is rapidly becoming the "new Chinese," with restaurants springing up everywhere, but I can say a few things in favour of Blooming Orchids -- the serves are generous, the service is prompt and corkage for wine is a minuscule $3 per bottle. Title: Best Crispy Pork Belly on Victoria Street
partial_entry:
I come to lunch at Jaidee Thai for one thing - their crispy pork belly on rice. Cooked with greens and topped with a fried egg with a runny yolk, this is the best crispy pork belly I've found on Victoria Street - and I've...tried pretty much all of them.
The pork is crisp and crunchy but not overcooked, and the runny yolk is a rarity in the other restaurants around here.
The restaurant appears to have had a change of ownership in recent months - I'm no longer recognised on site (and asked if I'm having the crispy pork) by the same waitress, and the spice level has dropped considerably. On previous visits, the 'medium' spice would have been 'my mouth is dying' in most other places, where as now I'd consider it 'medium spice for asian people' as opposed to 'medium spice for thai people' or 'medium spice for sichuan people'. Order accordingly.More

Title: Nursing home quality
partial_entry:
Went last nite with a friend only 1 other couple there and some takaway pick ups
Iv lived in balwyn north  for over 20 years and i rarely eat in my suburb maibly because i believe if you want a real asian experience you go...to Chinatown   and i am still right .this place  calls itself  malaysian  / Thai unfortunately  its neither.im of italian descent and i can whip up a tastier meal than what they served me last nite
 oh well maybe except for the roti.
Place is spotlessly clean and well laid out 
Only 1 staff member who must have trained in a eastern european restuarant  just put the food down no chit chat no smiles mo hello no goodbye
We ordered satay chicken and  san choi bow both reasonably  tasty  satay sauce was bland and tasteless from a bottle id suggest.
Thai r green chicken curry  and beef rendang i make an awesome beef rendang so was excited to get a  genuine malaysian one. Omg a couple of cut up steak piece still with fat attached no coconut milk  no  dessicated coconut no heat no spice no green beans it wasxedible but as i said before perfect for a nursing home. My buddy wouldnt let me point out these defencies to waitress /chef he gets embarrassed roti was ok though as was coconut rice.
Thai green curry same thing tasteless spiceless and a first with slices of potato
Dunno where they got that idea from
Obviously not from thailand
I suspect these guys use all their sauces from a jar cos they are so bland and tasteless the oldies in north balwyn would be happy. I v often wondered why this place is always empty now i know whyMore
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Nothing special and overpriced
partial_entry:
Nothing about this place is good. 
Most important thing which is the food is average. I tried green thai prawns, lemon grass chicken and some beef and they weren't worth it. Not tasteless but not tasty either. I don't thing the seafood is fresh which...is what I expect for that price. 
Next thing, the service is poor. The women was rather not helpfull. Like she was afraid to do her job and didn't interact with us. This is not what I expect in the restaurant. She also brought us a different dish and said that this is what we ordered. We accepted it because it wasn't a big thing but I didn't like the approach that she told us that it is our fault. 
I don't like the interior and the place itself. 
Last thing, the prices are extremely high for what you get. It is not a popular location, the food is poor/average, stuff is not nice, place is nothing special so I don't know what the price are for. 
BTW, we were there twice both times with the group of friends. Both times similar experience and empty tables.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Revising Previous Review. Disappointed & Angry
partial_entry: My previous review was very positive. However, there has been a change of management and the quality of the food has deteriorated. The duck in the Red Duck Curry seems smaller & tougher, the beef in the Pad with cashews is drier & more chewy...but the ultimate insult occurred on our most recent visit, when we ordered our usual calamari. To our disappointment & anger, we discovered that there was a little bit of calamari, but most of the dish was in fact fish in batter. Initially they denied this but finally the waitress fessed up but there was no explanation and no apology. The chef made no appearance to eat humble pie.. At the end of the meal, they had the cheek to charge us the full amount. Eventually we got a discount. If they have done this to us, one wonders how many others have been duped. It is truly amazing that they thought we would not notice.  Needless to say, our semi regular visits will now cease. We will not be dining at the Union Tree again. Totally unacceptable and very disappointing.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: A Reasonable Dining Experience
partial_entry:
Although the location for this bar/restaurant places it in the far north-east corner of Melbourne CBD, the courtyard and building wrapping around it provides a great environment for dining and drinks.

This review is based on two lunch visits with work colleagues. With a wide...range of dishes to select for individual dining or even a shared experience, prices are very reasonable and the ability to split payment makes it very conducive to work lunch occasions.

For the first visit the Penang curry with roti was my lunch, and for my second visit I tried the pad thai with pork belly.

The only areas which were not as optimal included the fact that there were no fans and the Melbourne weather for our second visit was a very warm day (30-degrees) so even after drawing close the curtain, the atmosphere was bordering on uncomfortable for patrons.

Service was reasonable and the time to serving food was quite fast given ours was a group booking arrangement.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
