Title: Unexpected delight
partial_entry: This restaurant is in our local area, an area not really noted for its cuisine. So not really knowing what to expect we came away more than pleasantly surprised. But the food here is what make it surprising as we found it among some of the best Thai food we had tasted in quite a while. The menu is quite extensive so there is lots to choose from. Title: Great Find
partial_entry:
Ive been here three times since I like it. 
Ambience: Warm, delightful, tastefully decorated

Service: The waiting staff are nice and friendly and the ladies are pretty with nice smiles. Attentive and thoughtful.

Food: I had been trying their different ways of cooking whole Barramundi...fish. All yummy. 
I always order the roast duck red curry, its ok. I did not like that they put whole cherry tomatoes and whole grapes. I want the normal duck curry without fruits in it. Three times I ordered and they never get it right like the Thai restaurants in the city. I wont be ordering it again. 

Its also good since can do BYO for alcohol. 
Prices: Reasonable

I recommend it for dating, meeting friends, family affairs.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Very good Thai food in the local area
partial_entry:
Eaten here twice and can say the food is very good. The quantity and quality of the dishes are very good and the service is also very good. Very clean and modern premises, large enough to cater large groups.

Really no complaints, maybe a touch...pricey, but then, all Thai restaurants are not cheap to eat in. We went with friends and had the banquet which was not cheap, but was enough food, maybe a little too much, which isn't a bad thing.

Total bill was just over $150 for 4 people.

Compared to Epping Thai and Narai Thai (Bundoora), I would make this restaurant better than both of them.

We will go back again, even if it is further to drive.More

Title: We now know why we were the only customers on a Friday night!
partial_entry:
Steamed Barramundi: 2/5
The flavour is great but the fish is either not fresh or overcooked. The flesh is just hard. Steamed jasmine rice that I ordered with the Barramundi appears to be old rice.

Fish cakes: 3/5
Probably the best dish of the night....Chicken Satay: 2/5
Chicken is tender but just doesn't feel very authentic and something was off as there was a sour taste. 

Banana with sticky rice: 2/5
Vanilla icre cream tastes a bit odd.

Price:2/5
Price came to $74.50 for two which is very expensive. You might as well go to Lee Ho Fook and get some amazing meals there. 

Service: 2/5
We were the only customers there and they didn't even know we entered the restaurant. Had to ring the bell at the counter after helping ourselves with the menus and drinks from the fridge. Staff is friendly though when they start serving you. 

Overall: 2.2/5More

Title: Tasty, cheap and quick Thai food.
partial_entry:
The eat-in restaurant offered a casual atmosphere serving Thai food.  They also have take-away.

Our entrees of chicken satay, curry puffs and roti bread were very nice.  The mains were tasty: Beef with oyster sauce, Sesame beef and Beef with Chilli and Basil (this was...very nice and extra tasty).  The red curry chicken was OK, a little too sweet for me.

This is a low key restaurant compared to the upmarket restaurants along the wharf in the Docklands, but the prices they charged were pretty cheap; eat-in food at takeaway prices. The service was good too.  They didn't have central heating, so it was pretty cold in there (but they did have heaters next to some tables), so might be best to get dressed for the cold interior.

Overall a nice meal, casual atmosphere with quick and friendly service.More

Title: 5/10 Thai - Takeway bar with Restaurant seats, much better around
partial_entry:
We booked for Saturday night 28/07/2018 and visited at 7.30pm at the restaurant for a small celebration, 3 people.

When arriving the takeaway part of the restaurant ( the front entrance ) was busy, and instantly we noticed that we were very overdressed.  We suggest...jeans and tracky pants.  We stood at the door for a good 4 minutes like lost tourists at a train station, with the workers walking past us, then finally a girl said “ Booking ? ” to which we looked around as there was about 8 spare tables anyway and only 3 tables seated.  So she grabbed 3 x rather stained takeaway menu’s and we sat at the rear ( the restaurant section )  We always tend to go by the type of people that are in a restaurant and it was mainly age late 60’s groups.

We brought a bottle of wine as the website says BYO wine.  Which, you would think meant that anything else could be purchased there ? not the case. When we asked for a beer they said that they were totally BYO ? and did not sell alcohol at all, so one of us was without any drink  ( never a good thing for a celebration )  however we shared the wine, all good. Maybe a licencing thing. The option would have been nice to have and I think that the website needs updating to BYO ALL alcohol.

The table was dirty, as were the floors generally, lots of little slippery spots, the décor was fine,  the seats were comfortable.  Generally, the look and feel of the place is nothing like the website. The service overall was slow, we poured our own wine, and the overall priority seemed to be the takeaway meals. Dirty plates were cleared after long periods and there really did not seem to be an effort on the restaurant side of things.

We have to say that the food overall was ok, not great, not amazing definitely and not anything that would return for.  Starters of salt and pepper squid were fresh, but nearly cold ( sitting around for a while ? ) the tofu was good, moneybags were fine, as were the curry puffs.  The mains was also nice, however on two of them,  they used a granulated dried garlic sprinkle similar to that found in the supermarket spice isle from Masterfoods,  instead of fresh. Possibly a cost thing ? who knows.

While the food tasted ok, everything about the place was a 5/10. Unfortunately, two out of three of us became a little ill the next day, enough so, that we were forced to remain close to any ‘Public facilities’ regardless of where we went.
This lasted for 24 hours so we would not return simply for that fact alone just to be safe.  This was the only meal we had immediately prior to this.  Might be a coincidence,  but worth a mention.

Overall, the hygiene was a 5/10 as was the service and the food.  An overall disappointing experience. Cheap, yes $90.00 for 3 people for entrée and mains. However,  I believe that you get what you pay for,  and in some ways to continue paying for the meal in the 24 hours afterwards ( so to speak ) somewhat overshadowed the cost.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

partial_entry:
We used a Groupon voucher for dinner at this little local restaurant on Saturday night. Most other diners I noticed were also being served the same set menu as us, so the voucher system seems to be a bit of a saviour for this little...place. The service was quick, maybe a bit too fast, as if we were being rushed through our meal. The place was nowhere near full, so I am not sure what  the hurry was. 
I travel to Bangkok several times a year, mainly for the experience of Thai street food. This Thai food was very dumbed down, presumably to cater to Western tastes? There was no chili at all. Green curry was sweet, stir fried beef was chewy and bland and the vegetables arrived after all other courses were eaten. There was no offer of whether we would like our food spicy, it just arrived as generic dishes. 
Tom Yum Thai was unfortunately, just a bit ho hum.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Pleasant service, food though doesn't reflect the exquisite name
partial_entry:
Tom Yum Goong (Prawns Soup) was my first love of Thai food. I've experienced this back when I was a teenager; it was and still is etched in my mind as a soup that hits you with its lime's fragrance and light spices, a hint...of chilies that invite your eyes to dive your spoon into that lightly dotted red clear soup.
Lightly, addictive well balanced soup with a hint of spice, sweetness, acidity, Lemongrass, fish sauce and those big Tiger Prawns, hence it will be that signature Thai dish in my mind, albeit the average $9-12/bowl price average in Melbourne.

This restaurant with a big name like Tom Yum is nicely located, great suburb of Melbourne, okay interior, pleasant service but sadly their dishes are lacking in punches and presentation, missing that addictive Thai taste in your palate.

I just hope that they'll do something about it, soon.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Online Order Blokes Bad for Business?
partial_entry: Tonight was the first time we have cancelled a main course after an unacceptable wait. Perhaps it’s a sign of the times. Tonight was a disaster. Also a bit of ‘lost in translation’ I suspect. My Thai is awful. The food is ok. But the real test is on say a Friday night where your order gets lost in cyberspace. Title: THAI-RIFFIC
partial_entry:
It's a modest kid friendly Thai restaurant in a quiet spot in Kew (but close to public transport) which ticks most of the boxes. As other reviewers have noted, the service is warm, friendly and efficient. It was our 1st visit and contrary to expectations,...the restaurant was relatively quiet for a Friday night although motorcycles with 'big boxes' on the back seem to come and go. 

We were a family gathering with a couple of  grand children Ankle Biters who were catered for on the menu.  The Entree choice was varied and tasty (Chicken Dumplings, Chicken Satays, Salt & Pepper Calamari, Prawn Crackers and Rotti as a side- all recommended). My Massaman Beef Curry was tender and tasty but could perhaps do with a little less sugar.  There were plenty of Wok Noodles, Wok Fried options and various Salads from which to choose. We'll return to Wokaholic which impressed! It's licensed and BYO with corkage.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Terrible Service - Wouldn't go back
partial_entry: My family and I have been twice, both times the service was terrible. The first time we were made to wait long time at the door before being acknowledged. Then we were ignored while waiting to order, the waitress served newer customers first, saw us,...and continued ignoring us for a good 1 5-20 minutes. We left on the spot. It had been a while so we gave it a second chance. After ordering our meal, paying on the spot and being seated at a table, the waitress came to us with an extra charge to eat in. My brother complained and she agreed to let us stay as she knew we were eating in when we paid. Still, the meal was served to us in take away containers with little plates on the side which we had to set out for ourselves. Just very shabby and unwelcoming service, didn’t make us want to return. Didn't feel like a valued customers at all.More

Title: Delicious Food but a Bit Expensive - $9 for ONE King Prawn. Odd Pricing.
partial_entry:
Food was delicious and hot (chili) so I liked that the food wasn't watered down for the Western palate. 

The restaurant is a clean and trendy little place on Smith St with friendly service but the pricing here is a bit odd - if you...order a large boiled rice for a party of 4, they then offer unlimited rice afterwards, very generous. They also had Happy Hour where they offered $1 freshly shucked oysters. Yet, on the other hand, we initially ordered the vegan pad thai ($16) but then decided to change it to the prawn pad thai ($25) which only had one king prawn sitting on top of the noodle dish. I think $9 for one prawn is a bit expensive for this place. It's not fine dining.

Either way, I will definitely return but I will order differently next time. The Panang chicken curry was particularly  tasty and is highly recommended (but it has no veggies, just a few Asian cherry tomatoes)More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Overpriced and terrible
partial_entry: We had a terrible experience here. Food is way overpriced and service could not be any worse. Firstly we booked in a few days in advance for a family of 6, and when we arrived they put us on the bar seating (seriously?) we purchased...a deal of a tapas type meal and ordered some more dishes but ended up waiting over an hour before the first tiny tiny dish came, and had to share that around with everyone because we were hungry. Later in the evening a table outside freed up so we moved over there, carrying our own plates cutlery and glasses, no help from the staff. Then waited for almost another hour before all the dishes but one came. We checked and they just simply said they didn’t write it down. For the whole time we were sitting outside, not one staff came and check up on us, when we wanted something we always had to go to the bar to ask for it. They didn’t even clear the table so we ended up piling all the plates we finished on the ground under the table. The food was okay but certainly way overpriced and didn’t compensate for all the wait and horrible service. So needless to say we felt ripped off and will never dine there again.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Delicious Thai Food!
partial_entry:
After searching for a good Thai restaurant, we thought Chalawan was worth a try and am pleased we did! Food was delicious, full of spices and flavour with good cuts of meat. Unfortunately the Miang Betel Leaf was unavailable but the Goong Ma Kam (Tiger...Prawns) were delicious as was the hot and spicy Larb Ped. The mains shared were the chicken Pad Thai, Crispy Pork Belly (yum!!!) and Massaman Beef. The only slight feedback was that although the Massaman beef was tender and full of flavour the vegetables (carrot and potato) were a little under done. Overall the meal was exactly what we were looking for and although not cheap, the cuts of meat were very high quality.

My only criticism is that the price point for wine is too expensive with a limited selection by the glass and bottles available for around $70. It would be nice to have a broader range available (esp. as quite an extensive cocktail menu is available) to better match the food cost.

Will definitely be returning!More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Second visit
partial_entry:
We first visited Chalawan the week it opened, and were impressed with the food, but not so much with the somewhat disorganised service.

A bit of water has flowed under the bridge since then, but on a return visit we were again impressed with the...flavours in the food, which were some of the most authentic tastes we've had in Thai restaurants in Melbourne.  We were also pleased to note that the prices have dropped substantially since opening week, and the menu represents reasonable value for money.  Unfortunately the uncertainty in the front of the house operations remains.  However, I suspect if you avoid busier sittings you'll still have an enjoyable experience.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Short-staffed & terrible service, food was delicious though
partial_entry:
Chalawan desperately needs more staff, experienced staff, staff that listen to their customers. We were there for nearly 2 hours for the Living Social deal of 3 courses. There were 2 wait staff for the entire restaurant, which, seeing as most were visiting on this...voucher and had pre-booked, they should have known was not going to be enough. 
People actually walked out because they had been waiting too long for service and food. 
We ordered extra oysters, had to request them 3 times and they took 45 minutes to appear. Same with the drinks - I ordered an extra beer which was forgotten about, half an hour later after being reminded it was poured. We ordered coconut rice, yet sticky rice was delivered to our table (it was delivered almost 15 mins after the mains, which we had nearly finished by then, so we couldn't be bothered sending the rice back as we would have been there til midnight waiting for the right food to be delivered at the right time).
Lastly, because everything took so long and our parking was about to run out, we requested the dessert to take away. The lady apparently didn't hear this, and said she would give me the extra beer for free. I assumed this was because i had to ask 3 times for it and it took 30 mins to pour one beer. 

However it turns out she thought i said i didn't want the dessert, so was giving me the free beer in place of that. I eventually got dessert to take away as was determined to at least get what we paid for, it was the smallest takeaway container with a couple of pieces of banana in and some ice cream. 

On the whole, disastrous. Which is a shame as the food (when it eventually arrived) was delicious. Authentic Thai, unusual combinations and perfectly cooked beef cheek, also crab curry was yummy.
 
Fantastic chefs let down by the customer-facing staff. 
Not listening to customers, slow service, completely forgetting orders, not knowing how to work the computerised order system and till. If they had got their acts together or at least apologised and given a reason for the complete shambles last Wednesday (1st November) they would have gained a lot of brand new customers as the food was yummy. But now we will not return. 

Also they have chopsticks on the table and not many forks and spoons, this isn't a Chinese restaurant!More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Interesting food, not cheap.
partial_entry:
Came here for dinner with a friend (Thai) to try out the food based on a recommendation.  On the plus side we arrived in time for the Happy Hour, that was $1 freshly shucked Oysters. In my opinion this is where we should have stopped....We ordered a curry "GAENG POO" and the "KA NA MOO GROB" with a couple of Mugs of draft Singha. 

Oysters, great .. came with a wonderful Chili and Lime Sorbet and dried shallots, I am a fan of Oysters and these were fresh and the dressing lively and with a hint of Chili.

GAENG POO - A curry with crabmeat ... well as I find consistently in Melbourne the Thai food is cooked with way too much sugar, resulting in an unbalanced taste on the sweet side. Both my Thai partner and I agreed that this was too sweet, and less sugar would have resulted in a much better result.

KA NA MOO GROB - This was a tasty dish, with the Crispy pork Belly, sliced thinly with a decent crunch. The Broccoli was firm and well cooked. A bit more Chili would have benefited the dish, but I understand that these dishes are typically cooked for Western taste-buds.
Overall the food was ok, but for Oysters, two dishes, rice and two beers coming to $84, I feel it is well priced outside what I would expect for Thai food.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Designer Thai
partial_entry: This is very busy Thai with a designer edge - even the more traditional noodles and stir fries come dressed up a notch and priced accordingly. Food is quite tasty, and service is amiable and friendly.  However they didn't take note of our special requests...and one dish we specifically asked for to be "mild" arrived absolutely laden with very hot chillies so it was inedible to the person who ordered it.  The wine we had was not great - however in fairness, could just have been a bad choice on our part. The chairs are high wooden bar stools (with no backs to hang jackets on) - and the restaurant offers absolutely nowhere else to sit your jackets so if you don't want to keep your jacket on for the meal, it ends up having to be on floor.More

Title: Yep - this is genuine Thai in a funky friendly restaurant.  Highly recommend
partial_entry:
Stopped in here for Sunday lunch. The restaurant was nearly empty, but began filling up during the afternoon with the window and outside tables being most popular.  

The service was friendly and attentive.  Our entrees came quickly. Then we had a steady flow of amazing...Thai dishes.  The calamari and pla pla (kingfish) were absolutely outstanding.  The other dishes were "normal" Thai - cooked perfectly.  

The bar area would be great for a date.  The restaurant feels a little like an upmarket night club with the atmosphere of a classic French wine cellar.  So having great Thai food over drinks would be a fantastic way to start the night. 

All up - 5 stars from me.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Local Business with amazing food and service!
partial_entry: This is a lovely restaurant with even better food. Locally run with beautiful staff is the icing on the cake. We found the portion sizes were very generous with out of this world flavours. For entrees we had the betel leaf (amazing!) and the beef...fondue (seriously amazing!). Then the mains we had crab curry (the best yet!), chinese vegetables (so fresh and crunchy) and the panang curry (flavours, wow!) - the slow cooked beef curry was also delicious. The dishes are spicy though, so as long as you can handle the heat (or ask them to make it less hot) I would highly recommend. I cant wait to come back and bring some friends. The ambiance and decorations along with the Chalawan (crocodile) story, is awesome!More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Icy Cocktails & Sweet Food
partial_entry:
Great atmosphere with very friendly service. We ordered the 3 signature cocktails, 2 entrees and 2 mains.

The food was great but simply too sweet for our tastes having spent many years travelling to Thailand, Malaysia and Vietnam.

We started with Son in law Eggs...and the Papaya Salad, which had a lovely spicy flavour, however the tamarind sauce and SOMTUM dressing were both far too sweet.

The first cocktail arrived after the eggs, piled high with crushed ice.

Our first main course arrived along with another cocktail, crammed with crushed ice.

Just as our final main course arrived so did our 3rd cocktail, mine. It was so full of crushed ice that I had trouble getting the straw to the bottom of the glass, then in 2 sips it was gone.... not great value at $20 although what I tasted was very nice.

The 10 hr braised beef in green curry was very tender although the beef tasted as though it was added to the green curry not cooked in it, the green curry was again, too sweet.

All in all, good food just too much sugar and good tasting cocktails made with very expensive ice!More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Must try vegetarian / vegan restaurant
partial_entry:
A totally random choice by the vegan in our group turned out to be a fabulous decision!
@cookatoo_kitchen is a simple place to eat in (or try the takeaway which was doing a  roaring trade while we were there).
The decor reminded me or many...eateries I’ve explored in Asia and beyond. 
Authentic. 
Simple. 
Whole food.
Plus a friendly chef and helpful staff. 
Plenty of choices on the menu for everyone, without being trivial and cliched. 
We started with #korokke which is like a croquette with 3 in a serve. They are a beautiful blend of  crumbed mashed potato, corn, pea, carrot, onion, green bean all served with sweet soy sauce. 
For main courses: Udon Pad Satay with a side serve of #rotibread
Poke Bowl with vegan chicken katsu. 
Japanese Curry Don with jasmine rice and roti.
@cookatoo_kitchen  is located at the Punt Road end of #bridgeroadrichmond
This is a must not just for vegetarians and vegans but for anyone who enjoys the taste of Thailand.

#allthingsvegan #veganmelbourneeats #vegqnsofig #veganmelbournefood #veganrichmond #plantbasedfood #thaivegan #thaiplantbased #veganbridgeroad #veganfood #thewanderingreviewerMore

Title: The Rating is meant for the service.
partial_entry:
Visited yesterday for dinner. The fried chicken ribs were fantastic. Pad gra pow beef were delicious too. Food wise they were perfect. 

However the service was one of the worst I have come across in my life. This is not meant for all the staff...but 1 particular girl stood out for the worst service. Obviously we do not know her name. All we noticed was she is a Thai with blonde died long hair. 

1) we waited on our table waiting to be served but eventually had to ask for menu
2) service was like an uneducated person with no basic human manner first day of work or like an owner of the restaurant who earns money anyway without customers
3) we couldn't help but notice the obvious girls staff gossiping about other customer

This brings a turndown to people who actually enjoys the food here. 

It is such a shame how much more successful this restaurant can be if only the waitress are properly sorted and trained. Not that customers expecting to be served as king or queen, just a simple basic human manners will do.More

Title: Disappointment in Chapel Street
partial_entry: Due to a family member being hospitalised nearby, my husband & I have been enjoying the restaurant delights of Chapel Street. Our most recent meal, however, was anything but enjoyable. Our entree selection of mixed entree for two, and drinks were delivered promptly to our...table and we were pleased with the quality of the food. When our mains came out, initially the wrong meal was delivered, beef instead of the seafood that we had ordered. While we waited for that dish to be cooked, we had Pad Thai with chicken & a chicken Yellow curry. The curry was quite bland & the chicken pieces were very large, fatty & tough. The Pad Thai was lacking in vegetables & the chicken was again in huge pieces & extremely tough & dry. Neither dish was enjoyable. Our order of Satay Seafod came out & looked fantastic. However although the prawns were well cooked, the calamari was so tough that it was inedible. We decided to dine here, in part, due to the reviews and recommendations plastered over the window. It has a quirky atmosphere, but the food component of a restaurant is the main reason that one chooses to visit. Unlike other reviews of this establishment on Trip Advisor, our recommendation would be to give this one a miss. On paying the account & asked if we enjoyed our meal, my husband was diplomatically honest about our food. " I'm sorry", was the only response & there was no consideration given to adjusting our account based on our dining experience. We have enjoyed many wonderful Thai meals, but this certainly was not one.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: A pity about the service
partial_entry:
A farewell dinner for a friend was my first visit to this restaurant (total party was 8 people). 

For simplicity we ordered a "banquet", and even though there were only 24 diners (incl. our party) they still took the best part of 2 hours to...serve the meal.
 
The two waitress' on duty didn't bother to clear the table of empty dishes, even when trying to find room for the next course.  In fact they seemed less interested in attending to tables than they did walking around with their heads down.

To top it off one waitress knocked over a glass of (expensive) champagne and made only a half hearted attempt to clean the mess.  A subtle suggestion that compensation for the $20 glass of champagne would be appropriate was met with a blank stare!

Would I go back - not a chance.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Good food.
partial_entry:
This is somewhere I've always wanted to revisit.  My first time here was years and years ago, and somehow just had my sights set on revisiting last night.  I don't think the decor or anything has changed since that first visit, as it was stuck...somewhere between the 70s-90s.

With that said, the service was reasonably good.  There were only a few people in the restaurant at the time we got there, yet somehow, all tables got their meals out of order.  The people ordering their meals just a half minute before us, got their entree 15 minutes before ours came out, but we got our mains before them.

The food was quite good.  I had the curry puffs and the chicken fried rice and all of mine was tasty.  My friends both said their sauces were quite salty, and apparently the cashews were soft and mushy.  The other hiccup was nicely resolved though - whereby two soft drinks were definitely out of date, so the lady offered to take them back and gave them a bottle of sparkling water at no charge.

It's a very nice casual meal here.  I think with so many other choices in Melbourne, there's no need to rush back again, but if anyone in the area asked me where I'd suggest they eat, I'd definitely recommend it.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: I drove 20 minutes out of my way to have lunch here a second time a few weeks ago.
partial_entry:
This little thai restaurant is located on Glenferrie Road just near the the glenferrie train station on the inside of a small shopping centre opposite BWS liquor. Walking into the shopping centre there was an explosion of thai aromas coming directly from the kitchen at...I, Spicy.   

I do not reside in this area and only walked into this shopping centre to purchase some drinks from BWS for later that evening. It was lunch time and I was drawn to try the food after leaving BWS.

Simple menu with lots of options. Food was quick, good value and very nice.
It's owned by an ozzie guy and his thai wife. I frequent Thailand regularly it's my happy place. I, Spicy reminds of the small little restaurants I eat at in Thailand.

Perfect for a quick lunch or a take-away dinner.More

Title: Great food, cheap eat.
partial_entry:
This is a reliable source of well-done Thai. It obviously caters to the student crowd, plus dinner guests, and since the table numbers are limited given the shop's small space, seats can run out quickly during busy times.

Once you sort out your order with...the Grump (you'll know what I mean if you happen to visit when she's there) - this requires looking at the wall chart, the somewhat intimidating sheet at the cashier AND maybe browsing through their photo menu, you'll be treated to delicious and (I think) authentic flavours.

My personal favourites include the pork shank and any noodle dish with the "fish noodles" which are essentially fishball meal made into noodle shape. Yum!

PS "Yen to fu" is the Thai take on yong tau hu, a noodle dish commonly found in Singapore and Malaysia.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Great restaurant
partial_entry:
My brother and I visited this small but quaint restaurant last night and we both enjoyed it tremendously. We got a warm and friendly greeting from the host Terry who told us of his new venture into hospitality among other things.
We started with duck...roti which we shared and the first bite realised that this was going to be a good experience. The flavours and the freshness of the vegetables in the roti made this memorable and try them they are great.
I had the red curry and my bro had the beef stir fry both were superb well presented and the flavours truly Thai.
Terry if I had one suggestion then ask your patrons as to the level of spice / heat they would like as mine was pretty mild and I would have loved some extra zoom. All in all fantastic flavours great ambiance of if I lived in Melbourne this would be a regular haunt. Well done Terry and Sopa!!!!!More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Authentic Thai Food - the best.
partial_entry:
It is amazing sometimes that just wandering past a place, you think, 'let’s just try this one.'  There was nothing special about the place, in fact you could easily think; well I hope the food is good.  Well this one worked, it was a great...surprise.
The owner was very friendly and helpful; and the aroma's wafting from the kitchen was encouraging.  We spend ages looking over the huge menu before settling on vegetarian spring rolls and curry puffs.  They were small, but very nice.  We then shared red curry mackerel, Penang curried prawns, and a spicy Thai prawn & vegetable dish; all very good.
The owner’s wife does all the cooking and does a fantastic job with very authentic dishes.  The service was good and we had a lovely meal in very pleasant surroundings.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Great food, great price, great place to eat
partial_entry:
This place is a little gem - for those who are tired of yet another Melbourne cafe/restaurant where you pay a premium for hip decor, boutique alcohol, and food that tries too hard - you just have to try this place.  We've been looking for...a great value food place around St Kilda and this is it.

Thai food done so exquisitely simply it's amazing this place doesn't have a waiting line around the block - simple ingredients in simple dishes with great flavour done brilliantly.  Straight out of the wok.  Clean, hot, distinct, flavorsome, texture - it's all there - and, a small selection of great Asian beer at reasonable prices.  It doesn't get much better than this.

We haven't been to Thailand (yet), but the decor reminded us of time we'd spent in hawker stalls in KL, Hong Kong, Phnom Pehn and the food...   ...I can see why people say Thai street food is the best in the world.More

Title: Delicious vegetarian/vegan lunch
partial_entry:
We have a Loving Hut here in Brisbane and I think my friend said it’s a chain. We came here after a visit to QVM down the road and were the only patrons here until a bit later. It’s a cute little restaurant and the...atmosphere is very relaxed. You go up to the counter to order and help yourselves to water and I think cutlery too (my friend did the serving).

We ordered the Jewels of the Sea, Malaysian char kway teow, wonton soup, sweet and sour vegetables with soy nuggets, salt and pepper tofu, tempeh and 2 bowls of rice for the 4 of us. My favourite was the Jewels of the Sea, sweet and sour vegetables with soy nuggets and salt and pepper tofu. The char kway teow was a bit bland and none of us were really fans of the tempeh (we ordered it cos one of us had never tried it before).

It’s been a while since I’ve dined at the Brisbane branch, so I can’t compare. But, this Melbourne is definitely worth a visit should you have friends who are vegans/vegetarians or you’re just after a meat-free meal.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Tasty & Good Portions
partial_entry:
We made a booking and when we arrived nothing had been prepared for our group and considering that we were the only people in there for the night, a little disappointing.
The restaurant holds about 20 people seated which meant our family of 7 took...up half the place.
It is a very quiet place and their menu is pretty extensive.
You are able to have a dish with up to 5 different varieties of main components.
We had a variety of entrees which were very tasty and of average Thai restaurant size.
All the mains that we had were of very good sizes and very filling, indeed.
Looked like a husband and wife team with hubby cooking and the lady serving.
It is not licensed so we took some BYO drinks and the children were catered for with standard soft drinks.
The freshness of the food can through and all our group were very satisfied with the meal.
Apart from the preparations, all went rather well.More

We ordered...the fish cake entree, duck in red curry, crispy barramundi on sweet-sour salad, steamed rice and wine.  The fish cake was tasty, duck curry sumptuously spicy and barramundi crisply delicious.  The barramundi was larger than expected and better to eat either with less food or more diners - but we soldiered on!  My only criticism is that the salad dressing was too sweet for my taste.  I would have preferred more fresh herb and sourness.  The service was swift and friendly.More

Title: Warm Friendly Service, Delicious Authentic Thai Food, Wonderful!
partial_entry:
I visited for dinner last night with friends and we had such a lovely dinner.

We ordered starters to share, then mains to share, so we had that great thing going on where you just get to keep diving in and trying new things.

I'm...gluten-free vegetarian and was very well taken care of. We balanced this with another guest who is vegetarian-eats-seafood and a guest who particularly enjoys meat and spice. Fun times!

The flavours were excellent, portion sizes generous and everything was delivered in good time. Prices are reasonable. Wine list is succinct and not very specific - this place is more about the food than the wine. 

Our server was particularly delightful, she made us feel so welcome.

Inside the restaurant is very comfortably set out and it's good for smaller or larger groups (we sat alongside a few couples and a gentleman dining alone) - it's a great atmosphere.

The only thing I would call out is that the lighting was a bit bright - it would be great if the restaurant could be dimmed.

Highly recommended if you love Thai food, are looking for a place to catch up with friends or are in the neighbourhood.  

Can't wait to return!More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Good experience except for MSG

Attentive young waitress and prompt service
I had...stir fry veg with prawns. I don't know why carrot and broccoli are in Thai food. It was however tasty and I had asked for medium heat  - I am not Thai so take it down a notch if you really don't want it hot! It tasted very good.
My friend had Pad Thai which was also good.
A great place to go. 

PS Just ask them to leave out the MSG if you are sensitive to it - woke up very thirsty during the night.More

Title: Reasonable Reuan
partial_entry:
On Glen Huntly road, not too far from the railway station, tis is a small neat and family run local restauarnt.  It has a fair choice off Thai dishes on the menu.  The service was good when we were there and the kitchen is readily...viewable so it lookss like all the dishes are freshly made on the premises.
A pleasant enough dinner but we felt that the taste/spice levels had been diluted from Thai spice levels so as to meet Austraalian tastebuds.  We would have preferred a little more z-zing in our dishes -  Thai fish cakes, an angel hair noodle salad, and chicken with ginger.More

Title: Nice local restaurant
partial_entry:

The food is very good, the dishes we selected on our visits were all...full of flavour, and compared very well with other Thai restaurants we have visited. Title: House of Thai Food
partial_entry:
This is a new Thai restaurant in Glen Huntly.
It is decorated in a restrained manner with tall wide windows facing the street.

I have purchased take-away food several times from here.

My wife loved the Tom Kha soup.
The kids enjoyed the Satay Chicken....I have had the Gaeng Massamun Neur (curry) several times. The meat breaks apart easily and has a wonderful flavour. There is plenty of potato, onions and peanuts.

The first time I came here was shortly after they opened. Thankfully the front of house issues have been solved by relegating the men back to the kitchen whilst the ladies take care of the customers.

The food is authentic, well prepared and has good flavour.
The take-away containers are thoughtfully sealed by cling wrap.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Uncomfortable, poorly planned seating.
partial_entry: Our group of 4 came in for an early dinner at 5pm. The space looks lovely but the restaurant has mostly high stool seating around tiny round tables and limited low tables which were all pre-booked. We advised staff that we would be in and...out quickly for pre-theatre dinner but we’re still unable to sit at lower table. We were here for one and a half hours during which nobody else was seated at said tables. Our jackets and bags had to sit on the floor under table as we dangled our legs on stools and juggled dishes, water glasses and wine glasses on the two tiny tables. Food was lovely but very small servings. Located in a great spot it’s a shame that this place misses the mark.More

Title: Food good but doesn’t match menu photos
partial_entry:
This was my third visit to a different Thailander and as a franchise, they each have slight differences. 
This one in the Galleria on the corner of Bourke and Elizabeth Streets is a busy one due to its location which also makes it a little...noisy. 
At 1pm, it’s buzzing with people on their lunch break. And plenty of choices of other eateries in true ‘food court’ style area, there is certainly a wide selection of global food to choose from.
Today, I ordered the massaman  curry plus roti. My small ‘cardboard bowl’ and the rice were served on a tray and I could choose from disposable napkin, chopsticks and spoon. Fortunately I’d brought that with me. Taste was good and served nice and hot. Not too spicy for me. A total of 6 pieces of tender beef in the bowl, two pieces of carrot and potato plus plenty of sauce that soaks nicely with the rice and roti. 
It amazes me how the revolving menu on the tv screens entice you but what is served looks very different. Not that the food wasn’t good but it’s just that you buy with your eye and my lunch didn’t look anything like the promotion. (See photo).
The meal isn’t cheap - $27 ish dollars for the meal plus an iced tea. 
Staff were good and service was fast. But at this price, it’s time to explore something in Chinatown. 
Notes: wheelchair accessible. Good seating for dining in. Not sure how much kids would enjoy this food.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Bit patchy
partial_entry:
My score 3.25 stars.  Convenient but mass produced Thai.  Service OK.

Vego curry puff - Lukewarm (from Bain Marie). Lacking flavour and pretty average!

Vego pad thai - Slightly sweet but spice level good. Not enough tofu but ok array of veg, nice egg and...al dente noodles.

Pork belly pad thai - Ever so slightly too sweet, although chilli and fresh lemon cut it back a bit. Pork was a bit variable - some bits bordering on dry, while others had fat that had not rendered or crisped at all (not a huge amount either, so not really worth the $ IMO).

Tofu and veg green curry - Tofu (not heaps), cabbage (odd), carrot (too big), broccoli was WAY too big and a bit coarse, green capsicum (which was quite big, but ok). Although the curry sauce was a little thin, it was quite spicy (which I liked)! Overall not bad.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Fabulous food
partial_entry:
The joy of being back working in Melbourne would be the restaurants and cafes that are opening again.

As a big #hokiennoodle fan, I headed to #qvmelbourne to try @thailander_aus off #lonsdalestreetmelbourne for a lunch time tasty treat.

I’m always reluctant to order food on...a computer screen at a restaurant but heck, gave it a go. And it was easy peasy. 

You can choose your protein, your extras such as roti as well as drinks.

I ordered a #currylaksa  along with a small serve of roti and a freebie iced tea because I scanned the code at the front of the restaurant. 

Service is a little slow - because so many people were ordering. Fine with me. Tells me that it’s a good place to eat. So within 15 minutes I had my lunch and made my way to one of the many tables to dine peacefully. 

Taste was pretty good and portion size excellent. Would like in future to bring my own bowl and cutlery as there is so much disposable wastage.

Notes: wheelchair accessible, plenty of other choices of restaurants nearby, friendly staff and nice atmosphere.

Look forward to exploring more of the menu in the future. 

#thewanderingreviewer #currylaksanoodles #qvmelbournecbd #asianfood #eatlocallysourcedMore

Title: Bland - I love Thai but not Thailander
partial_entry:
I love Thai food especially stir fry with ginger, basil, chilli and chicken. This should be full of flavour and delicious.

SADLY Thailander does not live up to the expectation. Except for the sauce being too salty and unless you get some basil, the food...is bland, bland, bland. The chicken has no flavour and there are not enough vegetables (unless you like chunky onion). For the price you pay, it's not worth it, because you end up throwing it away after a few bites. I've tried it a couple of times now, hoping it might improve, but it hasn't and I won't got there again. 
Sorry Thailander, but a big thumbs down from me.More

Title: Without a doubt the worst Thai food we have ever had! Save your $$$. Food court Thai is 20x better!!!
partial_entry:
We ordered mixed entree (samosa, spring roll, deep fried prawn and some weird dark brown pattie that looked like a meat pattie only squeaky and bland)
The mains; 
-Red curry prawns (5 prawns) with scant veg, 
-Green curry chicken -way over cooked / more than...likely reheated veg (green and red capsicum that’s it) in a very bland fatty coconut cream sauce. The chicken although fillet chicken there honestly would not have been any more than a whole chicken tenderloin sliced up. Very very poor!
-main of king garlic prawns; there is no way on earth those prawn were ‘king’ size; they were in fact frozen prawns, way, way over cooked, shrivelled up and tasted terribly muddy and messy old. I don’t think I have ever had worse prawns; same prawns in the red curry prawns. 
Not to mention the fact that the garlic prawns were served in a sauce you could only describe as oil with garlic plus extra oil -think oil sauce was just disgusting.
-the roti -again clearly not house / home made and not even toasted enough (still raw pastry patches)
-the rice however was the highlight of the order -we purchased 2 large steamed rice -both containers only ¾ full -not sure why a food establishment would be so tight as to only fill the containers for rice only m ¾ full beats me.

$80 down. 30min wait (and we ordered at 6pm -no one even dining in yet)
Not looking forward to polishing the porcelain tomorrow morning; I’m certain it’s going to be an epic event.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: This place will land someone in the hospital.
partial_entry: I just visited, ordered pad thai. I couldn't have been more clear about my allergy to garlic and onion (fructose), stipulating no fresh, powders, nothing. This time I even mentioned if they put any sauce into their food (having run into this problem before), please...check it! I saw the girl write it on the docket. No onion, no garlic. Returning to my hotel, I began to pick through and noticed first the chives, then the chunks of onion. Really?? I walked back, expected staff who were fully apologetic (yes, mistakes can happen). The chef comes out, not at all concerned. I showed him the onions I'd pulled out of my dinner. First he said the green ones weren't onions, they were chives. Obviously very knowledgeable about food.... then that the brown onions were in the pre-mix that they use for their pad thai; they don't cook it fresh. I said I was very specific about my intolerance when ordering. He took zero responsibility for his mistake, and certainly couldn't care less about the pain it could have put me in. Asking if I wanted something else, I said at this point I did not. He literally waved his hand in my face and walked back to the kitchen. Wow. No excuse for this. And if I had a peanut allergy or something else that could land me in the hospital??? There is too much choice these days for people like this to be cooking food for us.... for us patrons who are able to choose where we eat. I won't go into my refund process which was also horrendous. I walked down the street to Royal Siam. No onions, no garlic in my food and actually had fresh carrot and coriander...at Strictly Thai there was nothing but bean sprouts. And, of course...onion. If I could rate Strictly Thai in the negative, I certainly would.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Good food, poor service
partial_entry:
Booked online, and upon receiving the confirmation phone call was asked if it was a Groupon voucher booking. It appears that they get a fair bit of custom through that, and the nature of the service reflected this.

Upon arriving, there appeared to be at...least 5 people waiting to collect takeaway, a couple more waiting to order, myself and another group waiting to be shown to our table.  All covered by one(1) staff member who was also doing the serving to the existing diners and completely run off her feet. Those waiting to order takeaway simply walked out as they couldn't wait anymore and we ended up showing ourselves to our tables.  Thereafter was about 20 min before we received even the drinks menu.

We eventually ordered our meals, which included two entrees.  They waited until delivery of the first entree to advise that they couldn't do the second.

The food itself was tasty and standard Thai fare without being exceptional.

Will go elsewhere next time.More

Title: One of the best!
partial_entry: We love our Thai food - the flavors, the satisfaction of enjoying a great meal without feeling like you're going to pop & the want to eat it everyday. These guys nailed it! Fresh ingredients, delicious plates and that friendly Thai service with a smile...(without the constant 'in your face "are you ready to order now" typical waiter' service). The cleanliness of the restaurant was definitely an attractor, but everything else from there just added to our experience. With 2 children under 10, it's hard to find a place where you can relax, but the service and attention that these guys displayed was perfect. We will absolutely be regular visitors here.. It would be great to see some additions to the entree menu like pork or seafood spring rolls other than just vege, and the oysters definitely need to stay! The menu over all is more than adequate, which often make it hard to decide on a dish, but I guess that's a good thing. Dishes are well priced, as are the beverages - and they've got a pretty good selection. Best part of the night for me was the Chilli Basil Prawns with Veg. My wife lived the Pad Thai (claiming it was one of the best she's had) and the kids needed a further order of Tempura Prawns and Chicken Satay to satisfy. Overall - Awesome! Will surely replace our Fish&Chip Fridays with Strictly Thai! Just one suggestion however - please re-calibrate the light sensor in the toilet, me & my 6yo found it a bit difficult to see after the lights went out within about half a minute 😀More

Title: Worst Experience
partial_entry:
This was one of the worst experiences I've had in terms of food AND customer relations.
Firstly the food; we ordered the Pad Thai Chicken, Chicken Green Curry, Deep Fried Prawns, Yum Pet (Duck) and Fried Rice to be home delivered. The Duck and Green...Curry were acceptable with nice flavours and a good amount of spice. However the Pad Thai and the Fried Rice were tasteless and had no flavour whatsoever and the Deep Fried Prawns were far too salty and oily. Very unappetizing.
We called the restaurant explaining the situation and asking for a simple refund on the items which were not acceptable. Initially we were not offered any recompense, but came to an agreement to be refunded for the Green Curry and Duck.
Once we had driven out to the restaurant to pick up our cash refund, we were confronted by the delivery boy who stated that we would no longer be receiving the refund for both items, totally contrary to the agreement made with the employee over the phone. He claimed that it was our fault for ordering the wrong items (as if to imply there are certain items on the menu which should be avoided?) and that he was the one who would decide what the refund should be.
After a heated argument, one of the chefs eventually came out, realizing the error in them pulling out of the agreement and gave us the refund for the two items.
Unacceptable quality of service and food, given that over $100 was spent; very disappointed.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: True to recommendaiton
partial_entry:
This restaurant was recommended to us as having the best Pad Thai outside of Thailand - well it was 100% delicious.
The rest of the dishes we ordered were so full of flavour and ample serving size.  The lemongrass beef was so flavoursome and the...beef so tender.  The Panang lamb curry was equally as good and the Chu Chee prawns what a fabulous dish.  Extensive menu to cover all food categories.
I was told by the Manager that evening that everything is made fresh in house starting from the satay  peanut sauce and the spring rolls are individually hand made on order.  He also said the owners pride themselves on sourcing the freshest ingredients and all their food is MSG free.
I noticed that they cater well for vegetarian and vegan patrons. 
The outstanding point is that one of our group is coeliac and after speaking directly with the chef about her dietary needs she was very happy with the food she was served.
Great looking venue, very friendly and fun staff - love the background music
Highly recommend a visit 10/10More

Title: Worst Thai Food I Have Ever Had
partial_entry: This restaurant is set in a great building in Collingwood with painted brick and really nice touches everywhere. As soon as my wife and I arrived for dinner, the service staff hovered around us the entire time which was really intrusive. We ordered quite a...lot as we love Thai food and wanted to experience a variety of flavours. The disappointment set in early. Everything was lacklustre and would be disappointing if it arrived as a takeaway meal. Green beans were old and the vegetables were obviously the same mass produced crap that you see with take away meals. Thai places are usually a safe bet as the chefs tend to take pride in what they do. This was bland and disgusting. Lazy chefs that couldn't care less firing out rubbish for paying customers. Totally offensive. Signs of cost cutting everywhere and the place was empty, now I know why. I Will never go back.More

Title: Cheap & Cheerful Chinese
partial_entry:
We regularly drive past Dragon House and had never tried it so one Friday night we gave it a go for dine in. We were the only ones dining in, although we were there early at 6pm. There was lots of takeaway orders going out...though. 
The decor obviously hasn't changed since opening and is what you would expect from a small family run Chinese restaurant. We were impressed that the menu includes not only Chinese but many Malaysian and Thai dishes too. 
For $46 we got two entrees, two mains, a fried rices and corkage- plus we took home food, great value! Our favourite dish was the Peking steak! 
Parking is easy right out the front and there is also the IGA bottle shop a few doors up, handy for BYO as they don't sell alcohol.More

Title: Sensational Chinese Food
partial_entry:

Peking Style Chilli Beef brought back memories from our Canberra days...and who would believe it but the chef who cooked this dish is now the Docklands owner. Add this to Satay Prawns, Yu Xiang Eggplant and 3 cup chicken and we were in heaven.
The restaurant has only been opened 5 months and still trying to attract clientele that it deserves. Hopefully as Docklands grow, the residents of this precinct will realise a gem is right at their doorstep.More

Title: Fresh, Authentic Burmese & Thai Food
partial_entry:
BuuBBub has only been open a few weeks and I've dined there 4 times now.  I love the vegetarian selection, it's great to have so many options.

Last night I had a green Thai curry with coconut milk, vegies and tofu accompanied by rice.  The...flavours were wonderful, aromatic and clean - note that the spice is very generous (hot stuff!), so be sure to tell them if you prefer it mild, this won't be a problem.

Prices are reasonable and portion sizes plentiful.  

This restaurant is licensed, they serve beer/wine and you can BYO.  

Note that the service isn't so great.  The staff are so incredibly lovely, it's impossible to get grumpy, they just don't seem too experienced with restaurant work that's all.  On saying that, this has improved each time I've visited, so perhaps just a teething problem.

I have thoroughly enjoyed my dinner there every time I've visited and plan on returning regularly - will be a winter warmer to look forward to.More

Title: Scratches an itch.
partial_entry:
Always looking for "new" places to try, I found this little gem yesterday, and tried it for dinner tonight.  It's in a good location with plenty of street parking and while there's not a lot of curb appeal, it sounded good, so thought we'd give...it a go.

The interior is a little odd; quite a mish mosh of decor.  But it smelled good inside, so we were eager to see what the food was like.

They took our order promptly, and were accommodating with requests.  The food came out in good time, which was more impressive since they were doing a few take out orders.  The entrees were nice.  Generic chicken spring rolls and chicken curry puffs.  They were really nice and would probably order again.  For my main, I had the chicken fried rice and though it was really nothing to look at (presentation left much to be desired) the food was very good.  The kitchen honoured our requests for changes to the dishes, and the mains also came out in reasonable timing.  

From a pricing point of view, I think it was very reasonable.  Mains were in the mid teens, and on a par with other small Thai restaurants.  

Overall ... would I come back again?  If I was in the area, I'd definitely come back again.  There wasn't anything really bad about it here at all.  Considering it's almost a 30 minute drive from home to it, I'd be more inclined to try elsewhere first.  But if you find yourself in Sandringham and want a good Thai meal, give this a try for sure.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Good Thai food - short on fish sauce
partial_entry: This is a friendly suburban restaurant which serves mostly authentic Thai food. Tom Yum soup, and Pad Thai were perfect, although the soup needed some bird's-eye chillies floating in the mix. The weak link was the Larb Gai (chicken salad) which was pretty much flavourless...and bland. It desperately needed some fish sauce and some lime juice - there was a jar on the table of chilli paste and some of that helped, and I asked for some fish sauce (I was given about a table spoon in a tiny tub), and that made a big difference - but it was also missing ginger and garlic as well. Presentation needed sliced cucumber and more lettuce, although mint and basil leaves were present. In Thailand I love this dish, so this restaurant version was a big disappointment. The service was friendly and efficient, and the prices are very reasonable. The place was full with I assume locals, and I am sure it fulfils a need for diversity in the area - a popular place on the bay. I would try it again.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Disappointing Thai
partial_entry: Having just had one of the best Thai meals last night in San Remo, Vic, we thought we would try our local Thai restaurant for a 'takeaway' meal.  This is when our disappointment started.  The food, while cooked fast, was small in portion sizes -...the Roti is possibly the smallest you will find in the world, and the coconut rice doesn't taste like coconut at all!  The Pad Thai (beef) tasted as if it was contaminated by 'fish' and was very oily in texture.  A quick phone call to the restaurant ensured a replacement dish was cooked for us however we had to drive back to the restaurant to pick it up - there was no offer of them delivering it he to us despite this being a service they offered their customers.  The service was underwhelming and the cooking poor.  Overall this was a very disappointing meal - I would not recommended this Thai restaurant to anyone who is a lover of authentic, well cooked, well presented, Thai food.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Great food....if you can wait a while
partial_entry:
Had dinner with some friends at this restaurant recently and found the food to be delicious, especially the TomYum soup which was outstanding.  In general the food was a very high standard and reasonably priced as well.  One negative is its fully licensed, so no...BYO anything. But their drink prices weren't over priced, so its no big deal.  But don't expect an extensive wine list, because its pretty basic. 

The table service wasn't the best experience I've had, with the waitress rather rudely asking us to hurry up and order.  After we placed our orders we found the waiting time for our first course to be excessive.  You'd like to think that this wasn't pay back for the waitress waiting for our order.  However there seemed to be more urgency placed on the phone orders and pickups by on foot customers than that of the eat in customers like us which probably explained our long wait.  But when the food arrived, it was really good, so all was forgotten. 

So if you're not in a hurry and want to have a relaxing meal, then by all means eat here as the food it very good indeed and good value as well.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Service terrible.  Not enough staff. Waitress not speaking english.

Arrived rock hard. Sent back with microwave request. Came back just the same.Gave up at this point. Had to leave 90% of the meal on the plate. Food tasted nice but couldnt eat it. Full restaurant and only one girl serving. Poor thing was run off her feet and was pleasant, but could not understand enough  english to interpret anything on the menu. Would definitely not go there again. Got home still hungry.More

Title: Unbelievable
partial_entry:

I just ordered a meal pack through UberEATS. Two curries, naans, rice, samosa. 

First of all one of the curries was only half and it was a Dahl curry. I literally...had to search for the Dahl. It was just curry. There was a table spoon MAX of actual Dahl in there. One of the naans was a mangled mess as well!More

I understand it has changed...hands several times recently and used to be a bit dodgy, but the chef they have now is just great - I come from England and I eat a lot of Indian food, this is freshly cooked, well spiced but not hot, and well priced!

I just hope people discover it soon and support it, because the guys who run it are great, but it's quiet - they admitted to me they don't know much about marketing. But they sure know about cooking great indian food!

Title: Rude & Irresponsible Owner
partial_entry: Ordered Sizzling Beancurd for takeaway but they gave me Beancurd with Mix Vegetables instead. Rang the restaurant about the mix up in order, and the owner himself picked up my call. He gave all sorts of excuses and tried all means and ways to avoid...admitting his mistake. No apology nothing, OVER CHARGED me for the wrong dish and refused to compensate me for it, RAISED his voice over the phone, so rude and such a loser for his behaviour! Food is sooo average, they claim that they serve Malaysian cuisine but he does not even know how "Sizzling Beancurd" should be cooked, instead deceiving his customers by using mix vegetables with beancurd to pretend as "sizzling beancurd". Absurd and ridiculous, food is NOT AUTHENTIC Malaysian! The owner is a BIG LIAR! AVOID AT ALL COST, VERY RUDE AND CHEATING RESTAURANT! DO NOT TRUST!More

Title: Great Asian experience overall
partial_entry: My wife and I came to this quite small but beautiful restaurant via Groupon. We did not know what to expect because apparently is a new place in Melbourne. We ordered pork pan fried dumplings which were delicious. After that we got the red duck...curry and soft shell crab. I must say the flavour of the red curry was absolutely exceptional, one of the best I've tried. However, I believe the duck was overcooked in my opinion. The crab was also very delicious, and the dish made sense with the salad and its dressing. My only negative on this place is maybe the portions. You do not get a decent portion to be satisfied unless you order an entree first. I'd still recommend this place given its really nice Asian flavours. It is also worth pointing out that the service was extremely friendly and willing to explain/help at all times.More

Title: Good Asian Cuisine
partial_entry:
Tuan Kitchen is the 3rd restaurant to occupy these premises. It follows "Le Petit Bourgeois" which was there for nearly 20 years and "Omlette" which lasted 12 months or so. Le Petit especially is still missed - an oasis of fine dining in the midst...of more casual cuisine.
Tuan Kitchen is not "fine dining" in the traditional style, but is still fine food for a casual night out. It is certainly Asian in style, but covers the food from a number of Asian countries rather than being in the style of just one country. 
Over several visits, the food has generally been very good. Last night 4 of us shared 3 entrees, 2 mains, some rice and roti - the bill was $85, including a tipMore

Title: Absolutely poor excuse for a Thai restaurant
partial_entry: Ordered a red curry with crispy pork. The curry was mediocre in taste; that was tolerable. My main gripe is that for a $23 dish there was exactly 4 pieces of crispy pork, which was 90% fat and 10% pork, in the whole curry. Amounted...to probably 50gm of meat or one desert spoonful- I am not kidding. The rest of the curry was made of roughly chopped vegetables which were undercooked and loads of sauce. I realise this is meant to be “authentic” but have had better looking, tasting and quality dishes than this in little restaurants here and in Thailand. When I complained, the waiter was rude and defensive. My review is not the only one which contains complaints about portions, taste and service. As for the rave reviewers, are you sure you were at this place?!More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Could be so much better
partial_entry:

The restaurant is nicely...decorated and had a good vibe. Alas, the service was substandard. One person looking after everything. Title: So much fun, healthy & cheap!
partial_entry:

The concept is fun, you choose your favourite ingredients from shelves of spanking fresh veggies, meat, seafood, tofu, noodles and herbs. You deliver your bowl to the counter for weighing,...and choose a cooking style for your ingredients- stir fry, soup and noodle braise. Lots of flavour and heat options. 

My partner chose hot lemongrass (Tom yum?), I had Sichuan and the kids had mild tonkatsu. Delivered quickly, and everything was delicious. Service was warm and efficient. The manager even spent time teaching the kids chopstick technique. Drinks include Asian beers and soft drinks. 

This business deserves to do well. Clean, delicious and wonderful service. Great place to go with fussy eaters, or if you’re avoiding carbs or you have a mixed group of vegans, vegetarians and omnivores. Everyone caters for themselves. Brilliant!More

Title: @Siam Thai - @whatepieats - Reinvited
partial_entry:
So excited when we are re-invited to one of our favorites Thai restaurant, @Siam Thai. 
Located in the heart of CBD, it makes a wonderful choice for dine in, especially with a big group. 
They introduced us to a set of new menus from new...chef as well.

The staff has prepared the new menu for us for our visit this time. 
We only chose our drinks and menu - a “Feed Us” session this time :) 
Something sweet needed this time so we ordered their classic Cha Nom Yen (Thai milk tea) and Thai Pink Milk. 
The Pink Milk has rosy hint in the taste and overall not too sweet we like it :)

So here’s our dinner menu:

Look shin ping (Grilled pork and fish meatballs - 2 skewers) - $5.
    Simple appetizer grilled to have grilled fragrant dipped with sweet chilli sauce.
    So tender and chewy. Each skewer has three meatballs.

Yum ped yam nam tok (Grilled duck salad) - $18.50.
    Roasted duck salad with Siam dressing topped with sesame oil.
    A hint of zesty from the lime and mild chili. Simple and yet refreshing with the coriander and lettuce.

Tom zap leng (Hot and spicy Thai style pork bones and ribs soup) - $16.50.
    This one is the big soup with the pork bones and ribs inside.
    Love all the herbs and the richness of the broth of this soup.
    A hint of tanginess from the pickled veggies and herbs. Super fragrant as the soup was served. Love it to enjoy this with simple white rice in this cold weather.

Goong ob woon sen (Ginger prawn with glass noodles) - King prawns, fresh garlic, pepper, celery and glass noodles - $24.80.
    This is a very rare Thai food which we will find in Thai restaurants. The dish contains king prawns which are cooked perfectly, the meats were so sweet and tender with a hint of garlic and ginger.
    Love the glass noodles too which served plain only with herbs but complements the prawns nicely. This is our first time to try this dish.

Pad kra tiem prik thai beef (garlic & beef stir fry with dark soy) - $18.80
    Simple stir fry Thai style with garlic based. The beef was super tender and sliced a bit thin so that it is easy to chew. Perfect to eat with rice too. Love to put the sauce on top of the rice. Yummoo!

And for dessert, we ordered crispy banana roll served with vanilla ice cream -$ 9.50.
The banana was so smooth almost like puree inside the crispy rolls drizzled with caramel sauce. So warm and sweet and just perfect to be paired with vanilla ice cream. Super humble looking banana crispy rolls but we seriously love them.

Love how attentive and quick the service was. As usual, do not forget to check the spiciness level with the wait staff just in case you have low spiciness tolerance. @Siam Thai everything is set to be mild, so you do not need to worry. We love everything in the new menu and look forward to come and try their food again.

Note: We’d like to say thank you to @Siam Thai’s team for having us.

Disclaimer: Honest opinions expressed here are purely on our own and are based on our experience at that time

Yay: Look shin ping (Grilled pork and fish meatballs - 2 skewers), Yum ped yam nam tok (Grilled duck salad), Tom zap leng (Hot and spicy Thai style pork bones and ribs soup), Goong ob woon sen (Ginger prawn with glass noodles), Pad kra tiem prik thai beef (garlic & beef stir fry with dark soy), crispy banana roll served with vanilla ice cream
Nay: N/A

Service: 5.0
Taste: 4.5More

Title: Poor
partial_entry: Had dinner there tonight. Ordered Pad Tom Yum with pork. The waitress arrived at our table and said clearly Pad Thai. We pointed out no one ordered it. She went to speak to the kitchen then came back and said it was Pad Tom Yum....I questioned this as I eat Pad Thai at least twice a month, my husband makes it. Pad Tom Yum (according to their menu) is served with mushrooms, tomatoes and lemongrass no mention of egg. My meal was rice noodles with egg, a small amount of carrot and bean sprouts. When I pointed this out I was told they normally make it with egg, but didn’t have an excuse for why no mushrooms etc. I was really angry that they acted like I was an idiot. They offered to remake it without egg, but still Pad Thai. To add insult to injury it wasn’t even a good Pad Thai. No apology just denial. Not impressed.More
