Title: Siam Thai - @whatepieats
partial_entry:
Siam Thai is an authentic Thai restaurant located in the busy Bourke Street, Melbourne CBD.
This Thai restaurant brings variety of signature dishes from four corners of Thailand (Central, Northern, Northeast, Southern).
Each region has its own uniqueness, but it shares common elements of spicy,...sour, sweet and salty.
We’re delighted to be invited by Siam Thai to have dine in experience.

When we arrived, we’re warmly greeted by the friendly customer staff.
It was a humbly looking restaurant, clean and bright.
The place is pretty spacious, it can cater the small or big group.
The customer service was nice, polite and attentive.
The vibe and atmosphere were cosy and comfortable.

As soon as we’re seated, we’re advised that they’ve already pre-ordered the dishes
for us, it was more like full course menu with entree, main and dessert.
We’re more than happy to be served based on recommended chef selection dishes and here is the following dishes:

Drinks
– Nam Lam Yai (Longan Juice)
The longan juice was freshly served and it wasn’t too sweet. We just simply loved it!
– Cha Ma Nao (Thai Iced Lemon Tea)

Entree
– Chicken Popcorn Isaan
The chicken popcorn was perfectly deep fried and it wasn’t oily or greasy.
It was served warm, crunchy and crispy from outside; from the inside, it was soft and tender.
The chicken was well seasoned and had balance taste.
It was a simple dish but perfectly executed by Siam Thai team, good job!

– Bangkok Papaya Salad
The papaya salad was nicely presented and very appealing.
On top of the dish, there is a decorative chilli; I know it’s bit scary if you are not a spice tolerance person.
No worries, the taste was just mild, it’s more like sweet, sour and little bit spicy.
The overall taste was fresh, balance and perfectly seasoned.
All ingredients were freshly served (tomato, green beans, bean sprouts and others).
It had an aromatic and rich flavour.

Main
– BBQ Pork Neck with Thai Salad
The meats were perfectly grilled (nice col and well seasoned.
Great quality of bbq pork neck, the pork was very tender, juicy and soft.
If you want to have a nice touch of sweet sour and spicy, you can use the sweet thai chilli dipping on the side.
Honestly, the taste of the grilled pork was a fantastic by itself;
It’s definitely a recommended dish to order if you’re visiting this restaurant.

– Khao Soi (Northern Thai Noodles) with Chicken
The noodles was perfectly cooked; it was still tender and chewy when it’s served.
The chicken inside was cooked well and enough seasoned;
It had light taste to balance out the strong taste of the soup.
The texture of the soup was slightly thick.
Tips: If you’re social media lover, worry not about taking too many photos on this dish because you need to eat this one while it’s warm.
If you love a sweet dish, you should go for a Northern part of Thailand; Khao Soi is one of them and surely a perfect dish for you.

– Soft Shell Crab Curry served with Crispy Roti
The dish was generously served with pretty large soft shell crabs.
It was also come with the crispy roti on the side, typical Southern part of Thai dish.
The roti was perfectly fried and had a balance taste.
The soft shell crab was perfectly deep fried and it was served crispy and crunchy from outside, from the inside was tender and juicy.
The texture of the curry wasn’t too thick, still creamy and had a rich taste.
Everything was executed really well on this dish and put so much thought on this dish.
It’s a MUST to order when you are visiting Siam Thai, Bourke Street **The highlight!**

Dessert
Homemade Ice Cream Mango and Coconut.
The ice cream served in the cute glass perfectly fit a scoup of home made ice cream.
The taste was fantastic; It was creamy and the taste was rich.
The texture was smooth and soft.

Overall, we had a great time having dinner in Siam Thai and will add this restaurant in one of our  favourite list Thai place to go.

Note: We’d like to say thank you to Siam Thai team for the invite.

Disclaimer: Honest opinions expressed here are purely on our own and are based on our experience at that time.

Taste: 4.0
Speed: 4.0
Service: 4.5

Yay: Soft Shell Crab Curry served with Crispy Roti, Chicken Popcorn Isaan, BBQ Pork Neck with Thai Salad
Nay: N/AMore

Title: Authentic, friendly and tasty. Just missing condiments at the tables.
partial_entry:
Lovely, genuine Thai cafe. Prices are very reasonable, the premises themselves were quite small and appeared clean, and the staff were friendly.
I was very happy with my Chilli & Basil pork on rice - it was done the right way, minced pork with an...egg on top, just like I'd expect on the streets of Thailand.
We got a grilled pork skewers with sticky rice starter and the pork was pretty dry, chewy and hard. I had the thought that perhaps it's been microwaved, but who knows. It was a struggle pulling the meat off the wooden skewer, though the dish itself was tasty enough.
My only real criticism is that there were no condiments at the tables. I found that my food wasn't as spicy as I tend to like it, so to be truly genuine Thai, I would have liked to see the usual 4 condiments at each table for diners to be able to adjust the Spice, Saltiness, Sweetness and Sourness to their taste.
Being on Smith Street, people watching through the window was certainly amusing. At one point a junkie entered the restaurant and started behaving strangely, crouching down as if hiding from an imaginary goblin, then he laughed and left the premises. I felt a bit uncomfortable and was surprised the staff didn't immediately give him a boot in the backside and throw him out - I certainly would have, especially considering he was doing all this quite close to the cash register!
Anyway, all in all a nice little Thai cafe that serves food like you'd actually find in Thailand, not the usual dulled down stuff that the "local Thai restaurant" in the 'burbs tends to serve. I'll certainly pop in again if I'm in the area.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Not simply Thai is actually think Asia directly across from this eatery
partial_entry: Simply Thai bain-Marie was not even hot so I chose not to eat here as you didn’t know how  the food was going to be. Directly across from this store there is a place called thinkasia and my partner decided we would have some fried...rice and 4 fried dim sims when we sat to eat our food we found the rice was only just warm and the dim sums were completely cold from the outside and were just thawed in the middle. Stating this means the dim sims could have poisoned someone, they were obviously cooked from frozen and not checked in the middle to see if they were at a proper temperature. When questioned on what they had served we found the Bain-Marie wasn’t even hot and no steam coming off any of the other food either. I asked them if they were trying to poison someone and all they could say is we have a lot of trouble with the kitchen. I don’t think trying to blame the kitchen for this is a fix and would suggest no one eat here for health and safety reasons.More

Title: Surprisingly good food!
partial_entry: The reason I was so surprised the food was great here is because I've only ever been to Revolver after midnight to drink. I had no idea there was a restaurant here! The menu has a great variety of dishes. I'm a tad fussy myself...and was able to find a starter and main. The sweet potato & cashew dumplings were probably the best dumplings I've ever had. I'm not eating them every week but they were just perfect. I also had the fried chicken satay burger. I'm a fan of good burgers but I've never had one which captures that satay chicken flavor well - and the chicken was crispy. The jug of pimms was delicious too, full of fresh fruit. Would definitely eat here again!!More

Title: Krua Thai 2 - @WhatEpiEats Review
partial_entry:
We've decided to have Thai cuisine to celebrate our friends' birthday, we chose Krua Thai 2 because of its prime location in Richmond and variety of dishes.
They have the menu for vegetarian as well.
Location wise is perfect; easily accessible by public transport for...those who rely on it and plenty spaces of street parking if you drive your own vehicle.

The restaurant is pretty fancy looking Thai restaurant. It's more like casual fine dine restaurant.
The interior design is stylish, authentic and classic modern; each table covered by white tablecloths.
The atmosphere and vibe in this restaurant was really good and the customer service was good.
It wasn't too busy when we came on the weekend.

Anyway, we ordered:
- Chicken with Pandan leaves for $7.50.
  For the entree, we ordered 3 portions of the chicken pandan leaves.
  The chicken was well cooked. It was soft, tender and well seasoned.
  Unfortunately, we found that the chicken with pandan leaves was slightly too oily.

- Pad Thai chicken for $13.40.
  The Pad Thai was too watery and the noodle was little bit soggy. 
  Most of Thai restaurants would be able to nail the Pad Thai as the signature dish, unfortunately this doesn't apply to this restaurant.
  It was definitely not the best Pad Thai we've ever tried, and overall the taste was average.
  
- Tom Yum Soup Prawn $8.90.
  Really? The portion was so tiny and only 70% Tom Yum Soup and approximately 2 shrimps and around 15-25 thin slices of mushrooms.
  We even asked to the wait staff politely to double check that we ordered the large Tom Yum soup to share, she confirmed that this one was the large size.
  We would definitely understand if they charged us this value for more generous portion.
  Hmmmm.... anyway, the taste of the tom yum soup was really good and had balance flavour (sweet / sour).
  Nothing's wrong with the taste as we loved it, but it wasn't worth to order due to the portion and the price, I reckoned it's a portion for 1 person.
  
- Yellow Curry Vegie for $12.90.
  Surprisingly, the vegetarian curry turned out to be pretty good compared to others.
  The taste of curry was creamy, rich, balance and flavourful.
  The vegetables were well cooked, it wasn't overcooked.
  Happy to recommend this one.
  
- Sweet Chilli Tofu for $12.90.
  We found that the sweet chilli tofu was alright, couldn't find any special on the dish.

- Beef & Basil for $13.90.
  The beef & basil was actually pretty nice and well cooked.
  Unfortunately, it was too salty and we almost couldn't eat by itself without being accompanied by the jasmine rice to neutralise the strong taste.

- Thai Chilli Pork  for $13.90.
  The pork was served warm and had great presentation.
  Another great dish from our order, the vegetables and pork were perfectly cooked.
  The taste was absolutely great as well, it wasn't too strong.
  
Overall, the taste of the food wasn't that bad but it was pricey compared to other Thai restaurants as expected.
It was slightly disappointed by looking at the small portion of some dishes served.

Service: 3.0
Speed: 2.5
Taste: 3.0
Price: 2.5

Yay: Yellow Curry Vegie, Thai Chilli Pork
Nay: Pad Thai chiken, Tom Yum Soup PrawnMore
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: It's Black & White .....
partial_entry:
Who says Black & White menu isn't cool anymore?

The menu on Zomato doesn't do justice, it's one of those common print of "not-art", just colourful, crappy font set up with some 88 dishes that confuses diners on what they do best. It cheapened the...place, their set up and what they are offering now .... must be the previous owner, judging by the previous Zomato comments.

Thank God for the new owner and the new menu; in a binder, classier; much slimmer, simplified and still has some 55 dishes on it, they just can't help themselves in dishing out good Thai food :-).

Good, pleasant service, although they are not Thai as one Zomato reviewer suggested, quite pro-active and efficient, waitresses are all in black except the Manager/owner, so you know where to go.

Great "timber' frontage, the interior looks bright and classy from the outside, big windows, simple, not too cluttered, wooden chairs and tables that are clothed and lined with butcher paper, nicely set up, it feels "Thai". Mixed and matched crockery, Thai Blue White china, standard small heavy stem wine glass, however they looked after the ladies well, they've got their Copper spoons and forks while we are getting standard stainless steel ones.

Our orders were mostly spot on, they left out the Panang Chicken Curry in the kitchen but no drama.

We've ordered their "mini" Krua Thai Samosa - good; Pandan Chicken - must reorder next time (one of the best in Melbourne); Chef's Special Crispy Pork Belly and Chinese Broccoli, a few tough Pork Belly with that beautiful garlicky stir-fry sauce; Massaman Beef Curry - pretty good, tender meats; Grilled Chicken, lightly marinated nicely and some Coconut rice, Jasmine and a few Roti.

My only qualm on dinner; they run out of Duck Curry at 19:40 and their dish size/portion, they were just too small, especially that Grilled Chicken.

Parking was difficult and is probably the only thing that would prevent us from going there in the near future.
Well, we've got the best table for four in the house, by the window, semi booth style.

Much improved, classier B&W Menu, good array of "authentic" Thai food, I just wish parking could be a lot easier, kop khun krap - JT 27/05/2017More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Family Friends & fabulous food

Moved on to red beef curry (my fav) + pad Thai noodles with chicken...+ chicken fried rice, some Roti & a couple more dishes.

The staff are delightful and only want to please. 
The restaurant was full but the timing & service still remained 10/10.

One more plus - it's BYO which you don't find often anymore!  It's busy so you need to book.

Title: Very nice Thai Food along Bay Street - Highly Recommended
partial_entry:
Entering to a orangey lit restaurant, it gave a warm and welcoming feeling to a hungry Asian family.  There was a good crowd with chatter and laughter adding to the atmosphere.  We were served by a sweet Thai waitress who was always helpful though we...needed to repeat our order/requests a few times.

However, this does not take away the quality of experience we had there.  All the dishes we ordered were fantastic (accordingly to my young children critics) and the taste were authentic Thai.  The Pad Thai (noodles) was the most popular amongst the children and it was "finished" before we knew it.  We added Pad Neo (which I think is the name of the fried fish dish) and it was popular with my young kids too.  We also treated ourselves to a nice BBQ seafood (on skewers).  

No Thai meal can be complete with the Green Thai Curry (with Beef) which was not spicy and thus, even the kids love it.  For personal indulgence, I ordered a Tom Yum soup and it was full of flavour especially when it was washed down with Fragrant Thai rice.

Highly recommended.More

Title: Favourite thai restaurant in Melbourne.
partial_entry:
I have eaten here over 20 times and can't understand the reviews. I love this place, I understand the restaurant doesn't have a gourmet feel however, the food is amazing. 

The Golden Bags are a must for entrees and also the satay chicken. They come...out fairly quickly and if you order drinks you will be pleasantly surprised by how cheap the drinks are. For the mains it just gets better I order the grilled chicken with special shallot sauce or the stir-fry with oyster sauce which is fantastic. 

Make sure you get coconut rice for all the sauce left over from you meal and it's some of the best coconut rice I've had. Usually then instead of desert I have another serve of golden bags that's how much I love them. Defiantly try this restaurant or it's three sisters in the Eastern suburbs.More

It is licensed and had a good selection of non alcoholic and alcoholic drinks, including cocktails! Drink prices seemed pretty standard as far as I could tell. They do make a good lemon lime and bitters.

I ordered two meals one tossed from the wok and one stir fried noodles with two satay chicken skewers totalling about...$29-.  As I patiently waited at the servers window my experience went rapidly downhill from here.

After watching numerous people being served and meals being prepared at a steady rate I looked at my watch and wondered where my meal was... 10 minutes had elapsed and I perked up with excitement when I saw part of the order placed on a tray.  As I waited for the rest of the order I watched multiple other orders sit in the service window for extended periods of time while the rest of the docket was prepared... Meanwhile single meal orders flew out the window at a rapid rate.  It was then that I noticed checks ordered twenty minutes after my order were being processed ahead of mine while half my order stood in the window getting cold. Really? After waiting 20 minutes for my order and watching the docket debacle coming from the kitchen I finally mentioned this to a female staff member and was told "that's just the way the chef cooks things". After explaining the issue to another staff member to their credit they re cooked the cold order and had the whole meal prepared in under a few minutes.

As a Thai food fan my expectations were high. The meal was well presented yet failed to deliver not only an authentic Thai taste but one with actual flavour. The meal was palatable, scant on beef, Thai basil and chilli. The saviour of the whole meal was the satay chicken skewers which were delicious and perfectly cooked.  Overall I doubt that I would reorder.

Dear Thailander,
If a customer orders multiple meals on a check it should ALL be sent out at the same time!! Food should NOT be left sitting in the window for the rest of the order particularly with other customers leaning across it to pick up their orders.  Speed also does not equal quality.  Readjust your processes and consider food safety.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Enjoyable evening, could be "bravely"spiced
partial_entry:
Great location, parking can be challenging and the traffic around dinner time is just bad, add rain on a Friday night in chilled Melbourne winter.
Once inside, it has a different ambience, serenity sitting inside looking outside through the window, the busyness of Brunswick St,...Fitzroy.
Warmly greeted, lots of smiles and inviting menu waiting for us.
Great start with the Crispy Calamari followed by sweet spicy Tom Yum Chicken and Vegetable soup.
Green Beef Curry, Chicken Basil Stir-fry and hot steam Jasmine rice .... perfect combo.
It was a great and tasty curry, not as hot as I would expect.
The only downside of the evening is the rather bland Chicken Basil Stir-fry.
House White and Red wines are complementary to those dishes.
This place should be more buzzing on a Friday, there were only 6 patrons including us around 19.15.
We shall come back to try the rest of those dishes.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Tasty good value SE Asian dishes
partial_entry:
We really enjoyed our meal and will be back with friends very soon. The cafe has only been open three months. There is a very good range of dishes from across South East Asia, including a whole section of Indonesian food. 
My husband loved the...Char Hor Fan. I had Nasi Lemak with tender curry chicken in a tasty sauce. The bill was $40 for two entrees, two mains, one dessert and $5 corkage on the BYO wine. That's good value. Most main dishes cost $10. Seafood dishes are $11 or $12. I've attached photos of the menu with prices. 
The little cafe is close to the level crossing at Cheltenham Station. There are only seven tables. They offer lunch and dinner and take away. Like many cafes in South East Asia, there is a large TV on one wall, tuned to a commercial station - but not intrusive. The decor is attractive and understated.
We were served by a very nice lady who originally came from Jogjakarta.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Offers something the area needs, misses the mark
partial_entry:
Cheltenham is in need of a simple, fast food, eat-in or take-out Asian restaurant. Unfortunately, Bintang Kitchen has missed the opportunity.
While the prices are reasonable, I think they achieve this by using lower quality ingredients, particularly with regard to the meat. 
The service was...friendly, the meal delivered promptly and hot, but once tried the disappointment set in. 
I will be willing to give this another try, maybe it was an off night, but only one more, another failure, and I wont be back.More

Title: Terrible!!
partial_entry: Terrible service. The food was very average - I ordered Thai Green Chicken curry with rice. The Curry was quite hot and spicy even though I asked for medium spice. The egg plant was hard and inedible and it truly wasn't very nice at all...and a very small serving of rice to go with it. My friend ordered fried Barramundi with a curry sauce. I got my meal first and it took 30 mins before he and I asked where is his meal. They finally came out with Tiger Prawns! He didn't order that meal,,,so we complained and finally they gave him a refund for the $33 for the tiger prawns and stated they only had two kitchen hands so understaffed. They said - 5 mins for Barramundi.  It looked and smelt horrible and it was crispy and dry with no curry sauce!! It was so dry and horrible and it came with some chili spicy salad. My friend struggled to eat it and left the lot.  He didn't get what he expected. Once again we complained. We left and then the waitress and the Manager I assume came out and said aren't you going to pay for the Barramundi? We showed the Manager the plate full of food uneaten and that it didn't come with a sauce and we were totally unsatisfied with the whole experience, so eventually she seemed to understand and we left accordingly. I love Thai usually, but this is not god food or service. Don't bother.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Best Thai in the area!
partial_entry: With a name change to 'Thai Khon Kaen', new owner, Anna, goes out of her way to please. Although not on the menu, Anna provided a buffet for our party of 10 comprising a selection of 4 entrees, 8 mains and both plain and coconut...rice. With desserts, beers and coffees (we provided our own wines) and with a generous tip included, the total cost was only $50pp. Although not a fan of curries, I tried both the green and red thai curries. Sensational! (no pun intended on the old name).  The coconut ice-cream I had for dessert was unexpectedly creamy (like I remember ice-cream to be as a child) and refreshing. Will definitely be back. If I could offer any advice, it would be that the drinks service needs work. The beer drinkers amongst us had to call for replenishment on several occasions.More

Title: Amazing breakfast! (If you can get it)
partial_entry:
I have been a fan of this restaurant for at least 8 years (possibly more). I come and visit as often as I can, and I always order the breakfast which is the best in the Chapel Street area, if not in all Melbourne. It...is VERY generous in size, and being a Thai breakfast, has amazing flavours (I even order the Chorizo as a side which is not Thai obviously but it is an ENTIRE Chorizo sausage!).
The problem was (as I discovered on my last visit, last week) was that they are open for breakfast - WAIT FOR IT - but don't serve breakfast before 10am!!
I was baffled, as I've had SO many breakfasts here over SO many years, yet I never remember this 10am rule!
Not to mention that no restaurant/cafe in the area would bother opening for breakfast if they don't bother offering breakfast till 10am.
What tops it for me is actually that the sign in the window offers lunch from 11am!?!
I'm baffled - but if you can juggle this weird time schedule - the food is excellentMore
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Average
partial_entry:
Ordered online for delivery. While the delivery speed was reasonable, overall the food was very average and I must say for some reason I expected better. The roti was a bit chewy and could have done with a bit more cooking. The pork spring rolls...were good, although a little dry and didnt seem to be that fresh. I also ordered the drunken noodles with chicken, fresh basil and chilli. Well let's just say the chilli was non-existent. There was a nice underlaying flavor but it there was just not enough depth to truly make this dish enjoyable. In fact, I did not finish the meal at all because it was so underwhelming. The noodles were clumpy and stuck together, there was literally one thinly sliced capsicum in the bowl (why include it at all?). It had all the makings for a good dish but just wasnt executed right at all.

Overall, it was an average meal. Apparently this place is certified as an authentic Thai restaurant by the Thai government (according to EatNow.com), however I have definitely had better elsewhere.

Wouldn't bother with this place, plenty of better options out there for great Thai food!More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Unbelievable lack of care and responses when explained of eating needs?
partial_entry:
Unfortunately tonight MY WIFE AND I had one of our my unexpected lack of Customer Service Care and Responses in our 5 Decades of attending Restaurants across the World.  

Upon entry the Waitress was cordial and I greeted her in Thai and she responded.  There...were only only 1 couple in the entire Restaurant when we arrived, so the vast array of tables were open to our choice.

Before we went to be seated I spent some time to explain that 2 weeks previous I had had Stomach Surgery and we were down from the Country as was obvious by our Country attire along with my Akubra and in Melbourne.

I further explained I could only eat Soups and fluids, etc, but my wife obviously was fine, did they have anything without the hard ingredients , just the juices S we had had similar at other Restaurants.

The lady said the clear so should be fine so we became seated.  I even showed where the operation had be done on.my stomach/chest area to prove what I had said was correct as the conversation was quite jovial at this point.

Another lady came to serve us and I again repeated the conversation I had with the original lady and explained I just needed some soup with roughage, but obviously enough for a meal and the Clear Soup Chicken flavour was advised, so we ordered this with a Bowl of Tom Kai Gai for my wife.  

We also ordered 2 glasses of wine. 

The wine was delivered normal glasses $8.00 quite good quality.

Then the soup arrived in small entree size bowls at $9.80 each and my bowl had the entire bowl filled with vegetables and a little chicken in huge chunky pieces in a 1/3 if that of fluid of Clear Soup.

My wife's soup was exactly the same in same and components, except with the Tom Kai Hai soup mix.

Because the Restaurant was basically deserted, I had to go find a waitress and as her to come to the Table.  I had put the contents of my Entree Plate Soup on a Butter plate and showed her the entire ammoint of Clear Soup I had been served.

She immediately became very defensive and said they are running a Business and that is what you get.

I again explained I had already shared why I only needed the soup and non vegetable, etc mass and she dismissed my complaint and walked away.

I gave my wife the vegetables, etc as apparently they are very nice as was her contents of her Tom Kai Hai this is why I have rated this Restaurant 2 Stars, and I drank the 1/3 contents of Fluid from both the Entree Soup Bowl s which I must say was also very nice and would have enjoyed a Meal of either if Available, but this was not to be.

We finished and went to leave and pay.  The second Lady served me and I replayed what had happened over the Evening and even showed her also to prove that I was not able to eat Solids.

I was abruptly told I should not be going to any Restaurant to eat if I can't eat Solid food, which I found incredulous as we were 400 kms away from home in Melbourne and could only eat I  Restaurants, etc, and this was the first one after we explained before seating our plight that had acted in this manner.

Some had politely told us they couldn't assist, but others made exceptions or were able to rustle things up.  

This one obviously with so few customers simply had no care for the individual and only an eye on thefew $$ at the end of the visit.

Obviously won't be back, which is a pity as the fluid of the soup was lovely so would've been back when my Stomach was ok again in a few weeks and really sampled the menu.

Lesson needed by the Customer Service Officers, simply say NO if your not prepared to add extra water and herbs extra and increase the size of you Bowl of Soup from a Entree Size to a Normal Size in most Thai Restaurants.

Not Impressed.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Nice food but too expensive
partial_entry:
Altona is lacking cheap-and-cheerful dining options for dinner, but even in that context Sunset Thai is pushing the limits for the prices it charges.

The food is okay. Red curry with duck had nice flavours, and papaya salad carried a spicy kick. Staff are friendly...when they interact.

But $5 for a roti bread plus an extra $4 for peanut sauce or garlic spread? $25 for a salt and pepper calamari?

Dinner for five people cost $140 and that included a little one just having entree spring rolls and water for everyone. I would not choose to go here again, but as the only Pier St restaurant north of the train line that is open for dinner it will probably keep on gouging the locals.More

Title: A lot of room for improvement
partial_entry:
As we walked in to a dining room reasonable but not large we stood around for a bit long enough to discuss among ourselves 
1. Are we welcome here? Or do they not like 'walk in' patrons?
2. Should we just help ourselves to a...table?
3. Should we just walk out? 
4. Who are the staff members? 
5. Do we have to approach the bench? (Where there was a s cashier standing there)
Someone finally happened to come by and say hello and asked how many will be dining. 
We were led to a table. Again sat around for a few minutes until we happened to see where the stock of menu books were. So we helped ourselves to that rather than twiddle our thumbs any longer. 

There were some dishes in the menu which interested us. So we ordered 3 entrees (spring rolls x2 serves & small soup) and X1 main (beef, veg and cashew nuts), X11 glass of sparkling white wine and X1 glass of coke. All this costed high $70s

Quality of food was very low. The main was served on a sizzling plate that I never heard or saw sizzle. The food on it was already jelling on the plate. The soup was ok. Spring rolls were ok too. But not value for money. Quantity is reasonable. 

This is located a stone throw from the Altona Civic Centre across the roundabout immediate block if you are facing towards the railway. 

I can't recommend. I won't be back for a very long time.More

Title: Outstanding Thai in the most unexpected place.
partial_entry:
You would think that with the number of Thai restaurants in Melbourne that it would be easy to find a decent Thai Green Chicken Curry.  For many westerners it is the first Thai dish they had and with its use of favours from Kaffir Lime...leaves, galangal and lemon grass it is, for many of us, the signature dish for the whole cuisine.   So it is disappointing that most Thai restaurants in Melbourne either can't be bothered adding those aromatics or drown them in suffocating coconut creme.   
I therefore did not expect much when I pulled up to a lunch stand at the QV market with a hankering for Thai: the Tasty Thai and ordered Green Chicken Curry.   What a pleasant surprise.
The dish was simple as you would expect with a lunch stand: a plate of rice and a bowl of curry.  The flavours of the curry did high fives on my palate just as Thai curry (or indeed any Thai dish) is supposed to do.  The chicken was juicy and there were tasty bamboo shoots to add texture.  My wife was the first person in the world to discover that zucchini is an outstanding addition to Asian  stir-frys so I was astounded to find zucchini here.  
All up it cost A$9 bucks and was worth every penny.  I'd like to try it with a papaya salad and a pino grigio as part of a dinner some day.  As it is there are far worse ways to have lunch in Melbourne.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Service a bit haphazard

Title: Authentic Thai food
partial_entry:
A restaurant at this location itself is not new, but this restaurant has been under new management since the beginning of September 2015. As a frequent visitor to Thailand for the past 25 years I am of course a lover of Thai food and I...can honestly say this is one of the first Thai restaurants that I have eaten at in Melbourne where the food tastes authentic. The staff are extremely friendly and attentive and the owner/chef, unlike many Melbourne restaurants, will eagerly prepare dishes that are not on the menu. We have eaten there twice in the past 2 weeks and on our first visit we mentioned that one of our favourite dishes was Som tum (green Papaya salad). On our second visit the chef had pre purchased the green Papaya and made the dish especially for us. The portions are generous and well priced by Melbourne standards and the food arrives in the typical Thai style of 1 dish at a time. well woth a visit.
.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Great food, abysmal service.
partial_entry:
We went there recently with 2 other friends to this restaurant which is very comfortable and has subdued but very clean and neat surroundings.

You need to be unable to ascend to the 1st floor where the restaurant is, but once you are there the...food makes climbing the stairs well worthwhile.

Unfortunately, our waiter had quite an amount of difficulty with the language difficulties between English and Thai, nevermind, we were able to successfully negotiate this problem. However, it is preferable not to have to go through this at the start of a meal as it can make the situation uncomfortable.

When we eventually got our meals, not surprisingly, it all arrived in a bit of a rush, something that I have found disappointing with many Chinese and Asian restaurants - the food gets cold whilst you are taking your time over dinner and enjoying it.

We had a variety of dishes from a curry which was absolutely delightful through to other meals based on chicken, beef, and seafood. None were heavily over spiced, and the coconut rice was delicious. We could not fault the food. Even the deserts were very pleasant indeed and did not disappoint.

A word about the service - it leaves so much to be desired - the restaurant lets itself down so badly by the lack of attention to the service. We had completed our main courses; there was no attempt to remove the serving plates, etc after 30 min - which is excessive. Eventually, after catching the eye of the infrequent waiter service to our area, the plates were removed. A desert menu was then presented and following some interpretation difficulties, deserts were finally served.

Pricing is reasonable considering the standard of food that you get. Most of the mains are around $20 per serving. Deserts are between $6 - $10.

Drinks are also reasonable, although the soft drinks are somewhat on the high side.

Would we go back? If I could be guaranteed the service had improved I would have absolutely no problem going back. However, in the circumstances we found during this visit, there is no excuse for really poor service - we will not be going back.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

partial_entry: Went there for dinner last night. The restaurant was dimly lit which reminiscent to the Bangkok Sukhumvit local food. The dinner menu was resonably priced. We've ordered the Thai Fried Chicken, Seafood Pineapple Fried Rice and Pad Thai Fried Noodles. The  Fried Chicken was hot,...spicy and full of favour. The only down side was it had far too much flour...... Otherwise, it coud be a perfect dish. The Pad Thai noodle lacked seasoning and was rather ordinary and sad. The worst one was the Seafood Fried Rice with the Calamari which tasted like rubber with an extremely foul smell. We just couldn't eat it..... All in all, a very ordinary dinner which could be so much bettter if the chef put his heart to cook. Simple is beautiful..... If only he can put in more effort, use fresh ingredients, the outcook will be far more pleasant and rewarding.More

Title: Tasty quick and reasonable
partial_entry:
We ate a banquet that we were gifted with and had a voucher for. We had Tom Yum soup which was delicious and not too spicy (I don't really like my food too hot). Then we were served several entrees which included chicken satay sticks,...spring rolls, samosas which were all tasty and the satay sauce was thick and delicious.
We had a choice of two mains and chose the chicken satay (as most of the others were hot), and my partner had the pad thai which he enjoyed. The chicken satay was enjoyable. We were also served rice but couldn't eat it all. Then came a delightful little dessert of coconut ice cream and jelly in little cups. They were very nice to finish off the meal but we were extremely full when we left.
The service was extremely courteous and friendly and the Asian pop playing in the back ground leant to the atmosphere, the décor of this place is funky and quite quirky.
They had some lovely sounding specials of lunches for ten dollars for some soup, a main and a drink which sounded very nice.
Not a five star establishment but I would certainly eat there again as it was quick and a nice place to sit and watch the world go by.More

10/10

We booked this for pre show dinner. Didn't need to book as we were the only ones there, that sent up flags... There was a handwritten note on the front door saying 'Mind the Step', another flag..., plastic plants & staff playing on their phone...behind the counter, more flags....
Our meal was tasteless, no flavour.  We chose, Green Curry & Red Duck, the only way we could tell which was which was the colour, neither had that vibrant spicy Thai flavour that we all love & expect.  There was a choice of beers on the menu, but none available. Service was slow.  I very rarely no .. never write a review like this, but I was very disappointing and they need to pick their act up and decide whether they want to be a restaurant or just a take-away business.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Takeaway
partial_entry:
Looking for Thai food on a Friday night, we read the reviews and chose Nakin.
Ordered at 7.10pm and got a message that the food would arrive at 8.10pm. An hour to wait, we thought that was a long wait, but we agreed. 8.20pm came...around. Someone called to tell us it would arrive by 8.30pm. If we'd known it would have taken nearly 1.5 hours we wouldn't have ordered it. At 8.40pm it still hasn't arrived. So we cancelled. We went out to try and find some food and think we saw the delivery guy. They should have delivered the food for free or at least half price. But no, they turned around again and headed back to the restaurant. Terrible customer service. Won't be ordering from there again.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Uninspiring

My partner received her selection 10 minutes before I received mine.. Then my cooked breakfast order arrived cold and was very swiftly escorted by myself back to the kitchen with a hefty complaint.. In fairness the "chef", probably only arrived from Mumbai, just yesterday, so still has a little to learn about cooking in Australia.. Actually that's probably generous.. He probably needs to learn about cooking full stop.. What an appalling café!.. Title: Overpriced for lunch
partial_entry: Being able to get a table at 1pm on a weekday should have been a warning. The meal had to be ordered and paid for at the counter. My friend ordered Massaman Beef. It arrived in a small bowl ($18.95) with carrot in place of...the traditional potato. There was a timbale of steamed rice alongside it. I ordered chicken with peanut sauce ($17.95). The sliced chicken was draped over a timbale of chicken rice which was probably the saving grace. The sauce was not homemade as one might expect, but straight out of a bottle; possibly Chicken Tonight or Kantong. There was a small bowl of chicken soup with tasted of MSG. The drinks were from $4 upwards. No water was offered. All-in-all overpriced for the lunch crowd and disappointing in taste. Portion size was just adequate for the price.More

Title: Substandard and very disappointing.  Catering to the take away crowd not the dine in customers.
partial_entry:
I have been to this restaurant many times in the past under the previous ownership.  Since my last visit, some 2 years ago, the decor has been updated but sadly, the food has not.  My family and I attended on a Friday night and were...surprised that only 8 other people dined in-house on the night.  This speaks volumes to the restaurant and their food.  
Chicken satay sticks - dry and unappetising.  Thai fish cake - rubbery and definitely not fresh.  It took me all my might to cut through, let alone eat these.  
Larb Gai - once again, unappetising and the only flavour I could taste was the red onion.  I make this dish at home to a tried and true Thai recipe.  This dish was just minced chicken with a bit of fish sauce with some spanish onion.  When my home cooking is better than what I am served in a restaurant, there is something seriously wrong with the restaurant food.  The chicken was once again, dry and unappetising.  
Stir fry beef with cashew nuts - the beef was dry, the sauce was tasteless and there were no thai flavours in this dish at all.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Poor communication
partial_entry:
This has been a regular for our family over the years, with some great dishes. We've even been across to the sister restaurant in Eltham.

But this time we had a booking for 14 diners (family and friends) to celebrate an 18th birthday on a...Monday night.

Everyone arrived on time only to find the place in complete darkness. They had changed their days of operation but completely neglected to honour the booking or advise of their change. We had left two phone numbers for contact purposes. 

Chaos ensued. The night could have been a total disaster.

Luckily the Cross Keys came to the rescue and could accommodate us, but we could not be more disappointed with Nongkhai Thai. Maybe they simply failed to check their bookings at all. Even a call on the day would have allowed some changes to be made. Unforgivable for a local restaurant to simply ignore a big booking.

Would normally give them 4 stars for food, beverages, service. Now I can't recommend them at all. We'll never go again, and will encourage others to dine elsewhere.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Just An Average Thai Restaurant
partial_entry:
My wife and I have lived in the area for 8 years and decided that we should have a mid week meal there. We thought it's been trading for maybe as long as 20 years so it must be good.

First impressions were very good,...a nicely appointed Thai Restaurant with friendly staff all looking very smart in their Thai outfits.

After a look at the menu a very friendly young waiter took down our order and returned with a bottle of Sauvignon Blanc that we ordered.

My wife and I shared an appetiser of 4 curry puffs, unfortunately they were very small, had virtually no filling, it was difficult to find the minced chicken, potato or onion and they were overcooked.

We then ordered a serve of stuffed roti rolls (2 per serve) to share and we received 2 serves of roti rolls (4 roti rolls in total). They were quite nice and so we let the error go by without commenting.

For our main course we ordered one Mussaman Curry with chicken and a serve of steamed rice for two.

We subsequently received 2 separate Mussaman Curry meals served in very nice little clay pots, but again 2 meals instead of one.

I wanted to return the second meal but my wife didn't want to make a fuss and so we ate one of the meals, which was only of average standard, the curry sauce was nice but not sure where they sourced the chicken.

They offered to put the second uneaten meal into a "doggie bag" as we used to call them but as we didn't enjoy it we declined.

The cost of the meals was $104 and an extra $30 for the Four Sisters Sauvignon Blanc, about a 100% mark up, made it an expensive meal.

The service was polite and friendly but unprofessional in that on two separate occasions they served 2 meals when we had only ordered one.

I don't think that we'll be returning soon.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Delicious food!

All delicious, and plenty to share. No tea or coffee was a surprise, but there is a variety of cold drinks on offer. We stuck with water, and that was fine. Title: Asian Street Food
partial_entry: It styles itself as serving Asian Street Food, but I found the prices a bit higher than that, although the decor suits the mood.  I noticed Taiwanese, Japanese, Thai, Italian, and burger places.  You pay at the central cashier and then await a call on...your mobile to say the food is ready to collect from the stall you chose.  I selected a Tempura Don from Shinbashi (Japanese).  It was delicious, but a bit dearer than it should have been.  There are also some Asian groceries available, mostly drinks.More

Title: Dinner in Bourke St.
partial_entry:
Arrived late in Melbourne and this place is on the ground floor of our hotel. We were 2 walk ins.
Menu was Thai and plenty to choose from. I had a Pad See Ew. and my wife had a sea food fried rice (GF). Both...were excellent.
The place was busy and they did have a seating queue outside on the footpath.
Lots of local Thai people eating here so that was a fair indication the place is doing something right.More

Title: Super Fresh
partial_entry:
Walk past the overly crowded korean restaurants and you will find this gem! We ordered the chicken pad thai and a minced beef dish. The portions are good but what really made me happy was how fresh the ingredients are. The bean sprouts was super...crunchy! 

I tend to like a kick to my Thai food so the minced beef dish was great. My dad found it too spicy though so it really depends on your preference. 

Service was quick and friendly. It's definitely a place to drop by for a quick bite and reasonable and delicious Thai food.More

Title: Best Thai in Melbourne!!
partial_entry:
It’s better than fancy! 

1. Great sound system with good beats. Downtempo, jazz, modern electronic with a world element. 
2. Superb decor with perfectly place dim lighting. 
3. Impeccable staff with beautiful dispositions; who are straight onto refilling water, tea, rice etc 

We ordered 6...starters, 5 mains, 2 desserts and a few drinks. 

Every meal from top to bottom was well balanced and immaculately presented. 

A great place for anyone who want to just sit back, chill and relax for a good few hours. 

You can B.Y.O, or not. 

Enjoy.More

Title: Magnificent Asian surprise .
partial_entry:
My lunch group has been visiting Victoria st for the cheap and cheerful Asian meal while we bring some spectacular aged wines . Have been doing it since 1998.
Every now and again , you get a stand out . 
Wonderful consistent presentations like LoiLoi...was a mainstay of ours . 
But I must tell you . The new major favourite is The Seasoning House . 
Every dish from the Prawn Salad to the BBQ roast beef and Lamb . And the stand out ....the Tamarind Crispy Duck ...wow. What an amazing dish . 
The service is quiet reserved and unobtrusive . 
I don’t know why this place isn’t packed and buzzing . 
We ate like Kings (pigs) 😂😂. $40 including beers :.  This is one of Melbournes best Asian restaurants. 
Give them a serious go ...Oh by the way ..I like chillli ..This place doesn’t disappoint. So if you have heart issues ask them to dial it down .More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: We will be coming back here
partial_entry: Many years ago this restaurant opened serving Chinese food, and was called The Wok, in a time when this cooking instrument was a novelty, for us Anglos. It has since morphed into Wokahlic, serving Thai and Vietnamese food, and gosh it’s good. Sadly, we’ll have...to drive two hours when we want to eat here, but it will be worth it. We had the pulled lamb shanks curry and a crispy pork. The curry was nicely spicy. One of the best meals we’ve had in a while. The service was friendly, and quick, in spite of a busy take away service.More

Title: Tasty & Good Portions
partial_entry:
We made a booking and when we arrived nothing had been prepared for our group and considering that we were the only people in there for the night, a little disappointing.
The restaurant holds about 20 people seated which meant our family of 7 took...up half the place.
It is a very quiet place and their menu is pretty extensive.
You are able to have a dish with up to 5 different varieties of main components.
We had a variety of entrees which were very tasty and of average Thai restaurant size.
All the mains that we had were of very good sizes and very filling, indeed.
Looked like a husband and wife team with hubby cooking and the lady serving.
It is not licensed so we took some BYO drinks and the children were catered for with standard soft drinks.
The freshness of the food can through and all our group were very satisfied with the meal.
Apart from the preparations, all went rather well.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: House of Thai Food
partial_entry:
This is a new Thai restaurant in Glen Huntly.
It is decorated in a restrained manner with tall wide windows facing the street.

I have purchased take-away food several times from here.

My wife loved the Tom Kha soup.
The kids enjoyed the Satay Chicken....I have had the Gaeng Massamun Neur (curry) several times. The meat breaks apart easily and has a wonderful flavour. There is plenty of potato, onions and peanuts.

The first time I came here was shortly after they opened. Thankfully the front of house issues have been solved by relegating the men back to the kitchen whilst the ladies take care of the customers.

The food is authentic, well prepared and has good flavour.
The take-away containers are thoughtfully sealed by cling wrap.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Great food....if you can wait a while
partial_entry:
Had dinner with some friends at this restaurant recently and found the food to be delicious, especially the TomYum soup which was outstanding.  In general the food was a very high standard and reasonably priced as well.  One negative is its fully licensed, so no...BYO anything. But their drink prices weren't over priced, so its no big deal.  But don't expect an extensive wine list, because its pretty basic. 

The table service wasn't the best experience I've had, with the waitress rather rudely asking us to hurry up and order.  After we placed our orders we found the waiting time for our first course to be excessive.  You'd like to think that this wasn't pay back for the waitress waiting for our order.  However there seemed to be more urgency placed on the phone orders and pickups by on foot customers than that of the eat in customers like us which probably explained our long wait.  But when the food arrived, it was really good, so all was forgotten. 

So if you're not in a hurry and want to have a relaxing meal, then by all means eat here as the food it very good indeed and good value as well.More
note: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Title: Offers something the area needs, misses the mark
partial_entry:
Cheltenham is in need of a simple, fast food, eat-in or take-out Asian restaurant. Unfortunately, Bintang Kitchen has missed the opportunity.
While the prices are reasonable, I think they achieve this by using lower quality ingredients, particularly with regard to the meat. 
The service was...friendly, the meal delivered promptly and hot, but once tried the disappointment set in. 
I will be willing to give this another try, maybe it was an off night, but only one more, another failure, and I wont be back.More

Title: This place god damn sucks..
partial_entry:

Terribly sweet, crappy quality...meat, no other way to describe it than saying it was absolutely god damn awful..

Service was crap, staff didn't care and they have a million signs plastered all over their walls about paying extra fees for things, or that it was CASH ONLY (which it wasn't).
